No tengo nada malo que decir de este juego al que tanto cari√±o le tengo, m√°s que cuando fue comprado por Gamigo (antes perteneciente a Oustpark) cambiaron muchas cosas que a√∫n extra√±amos los pioneros de este juego, pero es m√°s que nada por el tema nost√°lgico. 10/10 porque fue mi primer MMORPG y al cual le dediqu√© muchas horas llenas de felicidad y donde conoc√≠ a muy buenos amigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104006297', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1619333122}
review:
I stumbled across this game on my library. I'm writing this to see if maybe I might reconnect with people during my time in Fiesta Online. So here's my story:

My username was fernandez154(level 36 fighter), halo117(Level 90 something cleric). I was part of the CBT and had my title of Closed Beta Tester that I was proud of wearing throughout my journey. I started off in the Teva server I believe, creating a guild called CBT. I founded this guild with the same purpose as anyone with creating a guild. Later on, I found out about pking in those locked range level dungeons (1 to 36 or so). I turned my guild into a PKing guild, creating a huge impact in the pking community in those dungeons. I then created an army, that invited others to compete against my guild, experiencing so much wars (I had a blast). Even got those endgame players to create a community to go against me. It was fun being basically "infamous". I was enjoying this concept so much that I even went to another server and attempted to bring the majority of my guildmates in CBT to invade those same dungeons in that server, I think it was called Epith? And I called it EoT (Exiles of Teva). Get it? HAHA We'd have our username with the EoT tag infront of it, just ravaging those dungeons. Of course it didn't last long since we had to start fresh and I believe Epith had a lot of charmers than other servers. But if anyone remembers this journey, either fighting against or alongside me, let's get reconnected! This was the first mmorpg that I invested quite a lot of my time during my teenagehood. And I'm actually planning on taking Throne & Liberty seriously as I did with Fiesta Online back then. So let's get reconnected, whether to just catch up, or if you're interested in joining with me in my adventures in the upcoming Throne & Liberty! 

Thank you Fiesta Online for all the amazing memories!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088303517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32429, 'last_played': 1683057943}
review:
This was a great game for the first 20 levels, the character promotion to be able to use more jobs was a novel concept for its time. Now its probably known that this game is P2W, excessively so. Between charms for a 20%, 50%, etc limited use cash shop item to increase your overall stats, (health, mana, mount speeds etc...) to play this game without spending money I believe is insane. It is worth a try, only for the novelty of experiencing a game from the past, that is still running, but don't make this your primary game, you can lose experience upon death, (not a bad thing early on) however you CAN purchase an item from the cash shop to prevent this. 

In the lower levels you wont notice the major flaws in experience and pacing, but there are deadzones in the leveling brackets. to my memory, its the upper 30's, 45-60, 85+. I only personally leveled to 105, and that was a struggle. The 90-100 bracket was 1 single repeatable quest, (not counting the single turn ins, which amounted to maybe 1-2 levels total) which rewards a whopping 1% exp. They have done a few changes like being able to turn in repeatable quests in the field, instead of warping to town turning in, and spending 10 minutes riding back, and hoping the lag at times won't get you killed, and lose the 1% exp you just earned. (happens frequently).

TLDR: its a fun game to try, don't spend money on it, its not worth it. don't try to be a solo player, bring friends, its much better in a group.

(power level a mage, dont bother using skill points in pre 60 mage skills, they stop getting ranks after 55~)
points in SPR increase critical rate, -BUT ONLY IN CHARACTER POINTS-. Some enemies can be staggered with crit hits, for 1/2 a second. Mages dont need END/INT as much as people will tell you, Dex int end, for some reason in this game Dexterity causes you to hit the higher of your damage range more often.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091512755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13414, 'last_played': 1697944110}
review:
I finally did it..

        I burned the bridge that I kept crossing back over to.
Said many of times that I quit just to find myself back again.
Played cat and mouse with a state of guilt for not being/contributing enough in group efforts, actually one of the biggest reasons I quit the many times I did. Just didn't feel like I was enough.

        Regardless of the guilt, I would eventually press on and continue my journey.
See, this game can indeed be a long journey for people who want to reach max level.
During your journey you are bound to meet people.
I've gotta say, I've met some really solid people in this game and it's actually crazy the times I caught myself feeling like it was the best time I've had in like forever.
Like I'm literally feeling this way even with all the bad that this game offers, it's wild.

       It was a high and low cycle with both the high points and low points to a pretty extreme degree.
The lowest point in the game for me is when I got stuck and there was nothing I could do to change the situation. I then had to lean on someone who has spent a lot of real money or an absurd amount of time to farm in game money to then buy the real money progress that someone else bought. OR I myself have to spend real money or resort to insane ways to make in game money work to then buy the real money progress. Pretty obvious, It's blatantly pay to win. 

       You think of pay to win, you think of investment, you think of investment, you think of game life. When you think of an MMO's game life.. I don't want to think about it..

 Back to the upside! The high points!!! The good good that I couldn't seem to get enough of!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
       
        I can easily say that my highest point while playing this game was when I got to experience my journey and grow/develop with others.
        This game can be socially and guild oriented, and honestly it hits good with this one.
Due to the length of the journey and how much there is to do to get to max level, there is a longevity in it and a bond can form with people therein. It can really add to the immersion as well, did for me anyway.

       [Keep in mind that the content is nothing spectacular and in modern day would probably fall beneath standard.] 
But a lot of the elements that create the experience of going through the content is STRONG.

The way I was seeing it, that some people were seeing it, it was great, but in truth. It wasn't hindsight. 

I won't even.

All I will say is there is-
 What could be. 
 And what is.

Pretty straightforward yes?

        The only thing that causing me to come back was myself, my longing for the high points.
Focusing on what could be, rather than what is.
So this time rather than just uninstalling like i always do, I deleted my character, my progress, and in game account purchased features.

Can always just make a new character?

I deleted my account, and negatively invested in sabotage enough to lose all hope for what could be in this game that IS NOT and WILL NEVER BE what could be.

I am literally at nothing. Should be good now right?





God forbid you grow attached to someone along your journey...

God forbid you do it...

Trust me... Shit hurts.

It's like cutting off connection to a world to someone that matters to you.

Someone that made you feel significant. 


It's hard to feel at one with nothing, when you felt like you had it all...


X is dead fam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113848693', 'num_games_owned': 1170, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1693201234}
review:
[h1]Comentario Anal√≠tico: "Fiesta Online"[/h1]

A finales de la d√©cada del 2000 Outspark public√≥ Fiesta Online, un MMORPG para todos los p√∫blicos desarrolado por Ons On Software y comprado por Gamingo en 2011.

Su estilo cartoon y su simpleza mec√°nica hace evidente su p√∫blico target, busca abarcar al p√∫blico casual y de menor edad, y en su momento lo logr√≥ a medias; no obstante a d√≠a de hoy es imposible recomendarlo a causa de sus pr√°ctias nocivas de monetizaci√≥n.

Todo aquello que puede ser monetizado, est√° monetizado. Pod√©s pagar por vida m√°xima, da√±o base, da√±o cr√≠tico, armadura, probabilidades de drops, experiencia, regeneraci√≥n inmediata de vida e incluso reducci√≥n de cooldowns.

En el fondo es un MMO bastante gen√©rico, pero cuanto menos noto cierto grado de m√©rito en lo esencial, v√©ase la exploraci√≥n, el grindeo y el combate desde la √≥ptica de un MMORPG casual; y hasta donde s√© en su momento cont√≥ con un equipo de moderadores y desarrolladores muy carism√°tico y activo. Se nota que ac√° hubo muchas horas de diversi√≥n y risas, es evidente que su nula base de jugadores activos actual est√° ac√° por mera nostalgia y temor a despegarse de unos recuerdos nost√°lgicos, pero a d√≠a de hoy jugar Fiesta Online requiere de gastos constantes y demasiado caros para contenido que hace 15 a√±os quiz√° hubieran sido relativamente aceptables.

En su momento tuvo su auge aunque siempre conservado en un nicho muy espec√≠fico, pero a d√≠a de hoy apenas cuenta con jugadores activos y los 6 (o 7, 8 aproximadamente) servidores con los que contaba fueron mezclados en tan solo 4, de los cuales un total de 4 cuentan con una poblaci√≥n en "very low".

[b]¬øEn conclusi√≥n?[/b] Imposible recomendarlo actualmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133715282', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1420666216}
review:
This game used to be something special, at least for me. I made so many friends that I will never forget, so many memories that I still think about to this day. I also dished out thousands of dollars just to "try" and be the best. But I am telling you I wouldn't go back and do it any different. It was a wild ride, starting in 2008 as a complete noob and ending somewhere around 2014 as a legend of Apoline (at least I thought I was lol) Some friends turned into enemies and some enemies turned into friends. But in the end we all had fun, most of my old friends like to joke and say it was the worst game they ever played but they know deep down they miss it and they miss all the good times we had playing. I know I do. Sometimes I wish I could just log in and talk to all my old pals like we all never stopped playing. But we all moved on to bigger and better things. I may never download and play this game ever again, I sold my old account long ago and I don't even think it exists anymore. If It does, I hope it lives till the end of this game and whoever owns it now I hope you are having fun!

Sincerely,
BronBreezy / Kyuremu / Serikos / Stacker / Stackjimbo
Guilds = Rapture / Bowss_Squadd
I was there when Apoline got it's first kill on Karen
Miss all you guys

author: {'steamid': '76561198095389747', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2333, 'last_played': 1689017402}
review:
I come back to this game every now and then. It was a pretty decent chunk my childhood back then. Hell even kept playing it up until high school. Always had fond memories of playing with friend I've met on here, GM events, Kingdom Quests, spending hours upon hours leveling and getting my ass trapped in the PvP zones. 

Granted I wouldn't recommend it to anyone to play the game now if you're like, hella new to it, never played it at all before. This is mostly and mainly just a game that I think a lot of old time players come back to every now for nostalgia, just visiting your old MMO home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099169061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5863, 'last_played': 1467615044}
review:
This game use to be amazing back when Outspark owned the company. Even though the game was extremely unbalanced and pay to win, it was still fun to just grind all day to just get 2% exp of your next lvl, hang out in PvP zones and get the "Godly" weapons. Wish some company would bring it back to what it use to be, im sure a lot of us who have a lot of nostalgia would come back and play.

But the game is dead now. Hopefully one day it'll come back lol
Bijou server
Warchief, AoE_FreaK

author: {'steamid': '76561198430979768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1708653566}
review: I only still play this every once in a while because of nostalgia. It was the first mmo I played. I would only recommend it to children, or people who have never played one before to get a feel for an easy game. You can't do a lot of the content without a lot of other players and there's just not many people playing it anymore. It's clunky and very grindy. There's not a lot of online support for questions about content and quests. I rarely play it, mostly when I want to forget the world exists and get lost in something really simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561199237270546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1673434026}
review:
Okay, Time for a review From a streamers perspective.
As always comments are turned off to prevent trolls.
And this review will be updated if they make updates or as i play.

Let start off with startup:
1: they make you make an account with them (instead of just linking steam)
2: the start up settings mess up your PC. then you have to go and correct after getting in game.
(which in turn glitch's out steam)
Now moving along:
Gamingo has always made horrible games. just look at trove. 
Sad to say its a fact they are horrible game makers/ game runners.

 you can't  zoom in to see the characters face untill in game
( which mean extra steps to get the look you want).
2: the ui is so small i can't even read or see the icons correctly. so forget about playing it at all.
3. they have no controller support( hello 2021 called did you not get their notice of vr control, game pad control, XBOX control, PlayStation controls, windows controllers, touch screen, and mouse and keyboard. are all controller types used in PC Games.) you can't even properly program one.

this game crashed multiple times.
it looked interesting but the fact it took over an hour to even get it to work, combined with extra small ui
and no  game pad controller support ( btw this game was released for pc when game-pads were a  big thing)

seriously can't recommend it

review:
I was one of the VERY early players of this game back in 2008 and I still have a character.... on the most unpopulated server in the entire game. I tried to see if they could move my data over to the active servers and there's simply "nothing we can do"

Once upon a time this game was bustling and fun. Now it's just kinda dead.... Sad times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100138776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1672196617}
review: Este juego cuando lo manejaba Outspark era una joya, lo juego casi desde el inicio, cuando el cap recien paso a ser 79, llegue a ser el #1 Fighter en Apoline, y los primeros de los 4 servers que habia en aquel entonces en derrotar a Helga en el cap de lvl 89. Que buenos recuerdos. Ahora es un pueblo fantasma y todo esta muy inflado en precios.

review: This game has not functioned properly since the original sale in mid 2014, You can install it, sure, But good luck logging in to either legacy or a new account. I come back here every so often just in an attempt to relive the goofy fun I used to have here back in the day as teen now as an older adult, and am severely disappointed that this is even accessible on the steam store in an unplayable state. I'm not sure if it's because they don't have any servers anymore, Or what the dealio is but I remember when it first came to steam and it was most absolutely like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062636358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 62560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13423, 'last_played': 1703362796}
review:
I have far more than 400 hours into this game.

This was my first MMO; it has a place in my heart. It has never been updated in any meaningful way. They changed the looks of a few starting level enemies, but they now stand out in comparison to the rest of this very outdated game.

To all of the comments saying the music is amazing: I disagree. 
Songs are generic and heavily recycled for zones. You will hear the same four songs mixed from level 20 to level 70. The same one song will loop continuously in most zones. Few tracks are actually tailored to the zones they represent.

This is a very bare bones game in that sense that it is a decent introduction to MMOs as a genre. Basic classes. You'll get the idea.

It doesn't have an auction house. The market is run by individual pop-up shops, making entering certain cities lag because of the sheer amount of vendors there. It also makes following the economy difficult.; good luck pricing your items.

It is ugly. Since the game launched around 2005, there has been little to no update for anything. You can jump, but only as an animation? The environment doesn't visually match where you can and can not go; many strange invisible walls for smaller environment items like trees and buildings.

There is an INEXPLICABLE amount of typos. The translation reads poorly. Random emotes are peppered into NPC text for no reason at all like:
"not be tolerated. :-P"
The player character and NPCs also have some oddly rude or bogus dialogue, which is bland to start, but if you care to read them...

PvP is pay-to-win and closed. High level PvE also becomes P2W.

The most sensitive aggro you will likely experience. You will consistently pull something through walls without realizing it. Mobs don't care about environment, btw. They will walk through terrain to reach you.

It's bad game. 

Old players, welcome back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803082902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2127, 'last_played': 1686263303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122085704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28157, 'last_played': 1700167357}
review:
Reviewing this game as an older player that has come back many times, I've short of had a love/hate relationship with Fiesta since I was a teenager then the game first released, OutSpark had the rights for the game and it was not yet on steam. 

Let me start by saying that yes, this game is P2W, but it can still be fun if you just ignore that aspect of it. You can progress without it, it just may take a bit more time. But this is an older game so it's pretty much built around the big grind. It's a lot easier to get through the lower level zones and stretch your gear up to around lv115 then it use to be 10 years ago. Unless you fell like power leveling, but then you'd be missing a big chunk big content as a new player. 

Note: DO NOT PAY REAL MONEY FOR SERVICES ADVERTISED IN CHAT! There are still gold scammers in this game although not as many as there once were and they WILL pray upon new players.

Fiesta hasn't aged too badly as I feared it would, I have seen worse. The cuteness aspect of the game also still holds true. The armor looks better then the cash shop cosmetics (yes they are P2W as well), but that's my personal taste speaking. Lots of the lower level dungeons you can actually solo with a decent set of 'green' armor and pots. 
You can get to level 60 in less then a day. 
I recommend joining an academy in early levels, it's good gold for newbies. 
This is not an action combat game, it is tab-targeting. 

Now the unfavorable (aka inconveniences).......

The grind for leveling at higher levels is still a pain. That's expected though. 
There is still no world wide market, have to go from shop to shop looking for what you need, but at least there is no tax sink to worry about. 
You may have a hard time finding parties at a lower level. I find it stupid that some OP players tend to charge in game money for helping you complete a task as a new player (anyone under lv100.) Not to say that there aren't people that won't help, but just be aware. 

But all-in-all it's still a free game try out, so you don't really loose anything except a few hours of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024265719', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1707450521}
review:
A relic of the past and something i really enjoyed growing up as one of my favorite mmos at the time and the only mmo i can say i invested alot of time into ( 2nd being elsword)
but this game is a shell of its former self ever since Gamigo got their hands on it, its been in basically in stagnation 
you had a game where the GMs would be one almost everyday talking with people and hosting events 
players on hundreds and thousands of players playing everyone having fun with an mmo that you could run on the old hp computer and most of the time not have a problem. People just haven fun and the GMs also haven fun.

now due to stagnation the once great player base is gone, the old gms are gone ( atleast to my knowledge), events barely happen .

it pains me to give it a negative review for a game that brought me so much joy in the past but i cant ignore the problems and just say yeah play it i recommend it.

Feista wasnt a bad game in the past but with the lack of real updates , barely any new content, increased P2W stuff, and overall a decrease in the major playerbase as msot people who play are either old heads (like myself) or somepeople who jsut desided to try the game 

THE MUSIC STILL CLAPS THOUGH

author: {'steamid': '76561197968639547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4497, 'last_played': 1620774707}
review:
Extremely pay to win game, almost everything at Level 115+ will destroy your wallet. You will be required to put in more work than if you were to play Black Desert Online to succeed in Fiesta Online from scratch without help/veteran players assisting you. The only reason this game isn't dead is because of end-game players with a decade of play time who have spent too much money to ever quit the game so they continue to play.

The mechanics for each class are unbalanced and animations for every class are scuffed. Most low end content is dead outside of specific "Dungeons" which are called Kingdom Quests in this game. All instances require you to pay if you want someone to assist you that isn't your friend, which costs a fortune for new players.

Prices for item shop stuff is extremely expensive, they added a token system which allows you to buy the item shop currency with in-game currency, but it's extremely inflated in pricing so you get screwed no matter which method you choose to get item shop currency.

The community only has two faces, either really chill people who are usually really odd/socially awkward or extremely egotistical psychopathic losers that use their disability checks to fund their characters while they catfish as multiple separate personalities on each character then quit and make a new persona when people expose them for something perverted or they just become too hated and need to make a new personality.

Gamigo staff team are neurotic, there are multiple instances where the Game Masters on Discord will ban you for anything possible, they are extremely sensitive and unwilling to handle community outbursts like proper adults which results in a huge quantity of players constantly being permanently banned from the Discord. [u]As for in-game, you don't have to ever worry about being banned or jailed in-game since they NEVER MODERATE THE CLIENT EVER.[/u] People will world chat, map chat, and whisper you every profanity and derogative slur in the book and even if you report it, they will never ban the person. All things that result in permanent bans on other games without warnings, don't worry about that on Fiesta since nothing will get you banned. Everything just gets swept under the rug because they could give two F's longs the idiots at end-game keep paying thousands a month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010140507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 25125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4611, 'last_played': 1617055489}
review:
This was my first MMO ever, so I may have biased feelings for it.
Even returning to this game, I find myself addicted to it again. 
No, it's not beautiful, like Perfect World. No, it's not story dynamic like WoW. And no, it's not perfect, but it has that simplicity. I don't want a complicated MMO were I have to micro-manage so many skills and quest and such. I just want to grind, level up, participate with the community, and have fun.
If you want to partake in PvP features, it's a pay-to-win game. PvE features are easily free. I suggest purchasing the permanent items, such as the iron box for extra storage and such. It's worth the money. 
These days, Fiesta is a much faster game. I remember spending YEARS just getting to level 60, only for the community to die. 
Recently, I read that the community is at least rich again in one sever, and I've been addicted all over again. lol
TL;DR:  It's a good starter game for anyone new to MMOs. Expect crashes here and there. GMs also seem to be active again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035765589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 92, 'playtime_at_review': 7399, 'last_played': 1711299304}
review:
Ahh as soon as Gamigo took over this game from Outspark it began a slow downfall...
Back in 2006-2011 this game was one of the best mmos ive ever played. I probably had over 5000 hours into this game and i don't regret a single second. I had a group of friends from school that i played with and the amount of things to do at all times of the day was OUTSTANDING. I remember staying up with my brother, trying to be quite and not wake up my parents on school nights.
 I will never forget the fun this game brought me when i was younger.
If this was 2008 10/10 would recommend but i sadly can not in 2021. : (

author: {'steamid': '76561198248345412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1610166886}
review: Back in 2008 when this game was at its peak was absolutely amazing! So many great memories but after coming back to the game a lot has changed, (obviously) but the main reason I would not recommend this game is because there are not as many players in the same level as you. Kingdom Quests were the biggest event when it came to leveling up quickly & getting loot in the game. There are some bugs when you have to go back to your character screen and log back in to talk with some of the NPC's. Also if you had an original account and haven't played this game in years then everything in your storage is completely gone. All I had was what was in my current inventory. Unfortunately I would not recommend this game for long term, if you want to go back and take a trip down memory lane that would be the only positive to this game.

review:
It's a pretty mediocre outdated game, main story quest sometimes your character will glitch and job advancement quests are impossible to complete (I wasn't able to complete the level 61 job quest until my third character), npc's running through walls to pile on top of you while you get stuck on invisible blocks is also pretty game breaking and will certainly get you killed, and with an exp loss on death feature you can lose hours of progress very quickly over a glitch.

Every town on their most populated server is just jam packed with people who set up shops and makes the game lag to the point where camera can't be adjusted. 

All in all, looks crowded but as far as people actually playing, it's a very little number

author: {'steamid': '76561198866942343', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1574672782}
review:
The bulk of my experience in this game is on a Fiesta private server and if I take my experience on that server, which lacks obvious pay-to-win and has accelerated XP, my recommendation would be a fairly soft yes -- for those who are fans of older anime-themed MMORPGs with grinding and PvP. However, this is for the Steam version of the official servers.

The graphical style and gameplay are both quite dated, but not so dated as to significantly drive away most players. It has a cute aesthetic, some rather unique mounts, and opportunities for a variety of play styles. The game is very grindy though, especially for free-to-play players, and it will take you A LONG TIME to get to level cap. Most of the quests and other content on that road to level cap are kill and fetch quests, where creatures just slightly above your level will wreck you unless you are very familiar with the game mechanics and well-geared. It does provide a degree of challenge, but when one wants to progress to the end game content -- it ends up being more of a hindrance to enjoying the game than a fun challenge.

If you truly want to be competitive in end game PvP, you can just utilize the cash shop. Definitely not something I like seeing in a competitive MMORPG, but if this is something that doesn't bother you -- then the option is available here.

The Steam version also seems to be quite buggy, with many quests -- including starter area content -- not loading properly and making it impossible for me to progress until I finally uninstalled and downloaded Fiesta Online from elsewhere. Not sure if I'm alone with that issue, though.

Overall, there's a core game here that's not too bad and could be quite enjoyable for the target audience. With it's pay-to-win cash shop and overly grindy and repetitive PvE content, I can't really recommend it in general. I typically don't recommend private servers for live games, but in the case where the only available option is being operated in a greedy and in such a way as to be detrimental to promoting a fair playing field, I really don't feel all that bad about informing others about their options. Many private servers for Fiesta are out there that offer an experience that doesn't require opening up your wallet just to have a fair playing field.

Not a title that I can recommend on this platform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058671826', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1683736430}
review:
Before you read all of these other reviews just crapping on the game, let me set some things straight for you right away.

If you have never played the (Outspark) version of Fiesta, then you are not going to know what most of these angry people writing angry reviews are going on about. The game is as it always was, nothing has changed. So veterans returning after a long, long break won't really miss much.

Now if you are a new player to Fiesta, then you have to ask yourself two questions before you make your first character.
1. Am I willing to play a game that have very few optimization options when it comes to character look, and game visuals, because there is limited to none.
2. Do I have deep pockets, and can I afford to throw real money at this game so it don't take me 3-5 years to cap out a toon.

This game always has been, and always will be P2W. Don't let people fool you into thinking it is only a recent thing. It's been P2W since the beginning. The visuals are not bad in this game but options to tweak the actual look of the game are pretty much null. 

Now if you are ok with one, or both of these things, then Fiesta can STILL be fun, there is a lot to do, with many different zones and dungeons to keep you occupied for a long time. The game still looks great even if you can't raise or lower graphics settings. Also the community population is steadily growing as, people are more use to P2W aspects in a game these days because 90% of todays MMOs are just that.

FYI avoid PVP because that is where most of the P2W cash shop stuff is used. I mean who wants to fight a guy running around with buffs and a 200% damage boost. Not me.

One last thing. You can actually get freaking married in the game. They have a whole ring exchange thing that you can invite your friends to, that takes place in a zone just for weddings!! Although the wedding contracts have to be bought (you guessed it) from the cash shop!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990093614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1587781387}
review: I played this game when it first came out (and played the heck out of it). The game was super fun and kept me craving to come back. I ended up deciding to quit the game because it was just too addicting. Feeling nostalgic, I decided to download the game again recently. I was shocked that (1) the game hasn't changed since I played it in 2008 and 2009 and (2) people are still playing it! The game feels like an MMORPG that was lost in time. It's old, janky, and super bad. It was great back when it first came out, but it's clear whoever owns it now is just milking the poor souls who still consider this a playable game. RIP Fiesta Online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091091093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4155, 'last_played': 1588034644}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082417253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1586296656}
review:
I love open world MMO-RPG's (not the cheap knock-offs)
that being said, starting this game it seems to have promise although very dated graphics (which still doesn't run smoothly).
problems are- 
there's only one populated server.

people don't like to help in open world chat and even the two guilds I've been in while the game leaves many things vague until you eventually open a quest that explains things one at a time. (took a while to figure out how to even sell something)

you can only craft healing and buff items (no gear whatsoever)

the world is surprisingly small compared to how they make it look

nobody runs dungeons or raids even if you try to rally them (good luck getting any gear drops, you basically just use what you can buy at vendor for your lvl most of the time)

quest system... you can open it up and take almost all open quests on (and turn them in) wherever you are, losing the open world feel

you get two small bags for both personal Inv and Vault storage causing storage issues well before lvl 10 (have to pay to expand it)

This all culminates to a extremely linear, narrow grind with very little by way of options.
you simply play, follow directions, get to top lvl (one A-B option on last promotion)...

If you've ever played a good MMO-RPG you'll want to pass on this one (it may have been around for a long time but it's a cheap knock-off).

author: {'steamid': '76561198125951873', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1440972734}
review:
Fiesta is another victim of Gamigo. Back in the day when Outspark ran this game, it was honestly pretty awesome. Interesting environments, acceptable combat, decent visuals. Players had instanced housing, the ability to set up shops in any city, etc etc. Gamigo picked up the game and they completely ruined it.

The starting location is a good example. It used to be a varied port town with a lot verticality and wooded areas to explore. Now its just a generic forest town that really isn't worth a damn.

Don't even bother with this game. It's a shell of its former self.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963547216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1541731061}
review: There are so many better mmorpg's than this piece of work. I played it way back then in 2012 for years. This game is crazy pay-to-win. I remember GM's selling the best weapons to guilds. Racism filled guilds fighting and insulting other guilds, plenty of drama back then, corrupt GM's, botting and exploits. I even remember the company getting into financial trouble and sold this OP cosmetic item for $120 (for 30 day use) which boosted stats like crazy. I believe it was a guitar for the back accessory slot. Anyways, if you have cash to spend and free time throw it somewhere else. There's an unbelievable amount of pay-to-win cash shop items that almost seem like a mortgage payment with the amount if stuff you'd have to buy to be useful.

review:
Behind all of the jank and terrible design decisions, you've got a fairly fun mmo. A fairly fun *jank* mmo. The game is very, very pay to win, and very non-newcomer friendly with certain systems and mechanics, and yet I find myself coming back to it frequently even with other options at my disposal, such as Final Fantasy 14. 

There's a certain charm to the jank.

review: I've been playing Fiesta since it's release on and off. (mostly private servers though because they're not pay-to-win and actually care about their content). ANYWAYS, this game probably holds some of my greatest memories of PC gaming, and the gameplay and content of this MMO is actually insane, although the only way I could experience it was through private servers. I would recommend this game if you could find a somewhat populated server.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119838839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 56042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3150, 'last_played': 1689533672}
review:
Hace como 10 a√±os habia empezado a jugar este juego y me habia gustado mucho en su momento, pero le doy calificacion negativa por las siguientes razones

-claro es pay to win sin duda, aunque como subir? si entras en academia de guild ganas dinero, ahorras, y cuando seas lv 60 ahora si compra un arma 60+9 y con eso subes como espuma, de ahi farmeas jefes para vender cosas y ganar mas dinero

- hace unos a√±os hubo un tal llamado "merge" en aquel entonces habia 4 servers, uno de ellos muy lleno, entonces se les ocurrio quitar personas de ahi y poner sus personajes en otros servers, el problema como en mi caso es que mis personajes estan dispersos en todos los server, osea no en 1 solo, cada uno se complementaba con otro por que uno hacia pociones, otro scrolls, otro piedras, otro farmeaba etc, lo cual ya no puedo hacer por que tardas milenios subiendo las habilidades y oro tambien, algunos personajes se quedaron sin nada

-recuerdo que me habia casado en este juego, pero ahora ni idea de donde quedo ella, me quitaron el estado wedding, el buff tambien y eso que lo pagas con dinero real

-y la principal razon, mi personaje principal tenia equipamiento nivel 105 + 10 color azul de jefe y 2 ellos no los tengo, de alguna forma se perdio, al igual que mi montura 200 + 80

Its such a childhood game that I won't ever forget. I want the company to include exchange of Steam currency for Slime Coins. Its 2019. The company needs to integrate this that way we won't have to spend Karma Koins because what if we don't have Karma Koins in our store? We mostly buy Steam cards for the most part. Steam and Gamigo needs to get this together because I bet there's gonna be a whole bunch of agreement to that.

Also I want to add the idea of permanent costumes. I want permanent costumes at least some of them because I am sick and tired of 30 day limitations regardless of removing the stats if its a permanent. I want my character to look good despite the stat withdrawal. Cosmetics are something that the players appreciate for their characters. So please Gamigo, when are you gonna make permanent costumes for the store?

author: {'steamid': '76561198209851437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2217, 'last_played': 1509670761}
review: I played this game growing up, most of my teen years. This game was great at one point, but it's that time for this game, dead server. The graphics are outdated and the new "Gamingo" development team doesn't have much experience running an MMO RPG, which shows. Back when "Outspark" ran fiesta there was more stability in the server as well as not so much pay 2 play. This game used to be playable when the markets werent massively inflated, which makes anything end game nearly impossible to beat with out spending money one way or another. The new developers are trying, or tried, to squeeze every last cent by making anything level 60-100 difficult with out spending to power up your gear. It gets worse from there, after 100 you have to keep upgrading your gear and possibly even spend more on power up "charms" in order to stand a chance against some base level monsters, and only gets worse and more expensive as you progress to the cap of 135. Having played through both OS and Gamingo, this game had its time but its time to move on or else they'll get you by the wallet. PVP is a whole other beast, more time, more money, more frustration. Not worth it anymore guys sorry, it hurts me to say this because I really enjoyed my time on this game.  Have fun gaming guys! ~~ Hope this helps anyone, preferably from wasting their time and money on a dead game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115901650', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3542, 'last_played': 1708331350}
review:
for me it's nostalgic, so I'm a bit biased. it was one of my first MMORPGs. honestly, it's beautiful graphically. everything is either cute or pretty, and the cel shading is just amazing to me. gameplay-wise, it's really simple. buffs last for like an hour or so, and the other skills are pretty much just use off cooldown, except for archer, which is "poison the mobs then kite literally forever."

all the quests are the same, essentially. the story is kinda neat, I think. I haven't really looked at it much, I'm too ADHD for that. least you can spam click through it though!

it's...kinda active? it's got a playerbase. a lot of it is just whales now though. and yes, the game is p2w, undeniably. cosmetics have stat bonuses attached to them, and while I haven't reached that level of content, nor will I probably ever as I only play this in passing now, I doubt any end-game content is soloable without paying through the nose. honestly though the kingdom quest system works well around that, considering it's literally just public raids at set times.

healers can, albeit slowly, level up reasonably well solo. if you die in solo pve as a cleric you're doing something very wrong, considering how many heals you get. I picked cleric, again for nostalgia, and have been enjoying it so far. real simple, not much thinking, and in raids, everyone always wants you in their party. you will literally get instantly invited for every kingdom quest party. makes  things real simple. just keep people alive is all. don't even attack beyond what you have to.

I think it's worth trying at least. worth buying anything, probably no. but definitely a good mmo to just chill on and play around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105034993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1614484483}
review:
The game is basically dead now, but if you played it as a kid, you owe it to yourself to reinstall it for the nostalgia. If you've never played it before, probably don't bother, but do look up the soundtrack on Youtube. I mean, the soundtrack is so incredibly good. 

But if you did play the game as a kid, Listen to the soundtrack on Youtube, feel the memories pour over you, reinstall out of nostalgia, realise it's dead, uninstall. Repeat every few years or so. 10/10, would reinstall again.

review: Yes I played this game back when it came out , yes i can admit i have nostalgia, but it is a really fun MMORPG even if your "NEW" to the game. It holds up today graphically and fun wise, plus I like the weapon and gear upgrade systems in these old RPGs. seems like most rps these days lose out on these upgrade systems , glows that really set you apart from other players and show off just how lucky or long you have been playing the game to get gear at certain glows. since most MMORPGs that are 10+ years or even way less shutdown and most dont get a chance to experience. I hope someone reads this and gives this game a whirl I assure you this game doesn't dissappoint!

author: {'steamid': '76561198387805040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22652, 'last_played': 1654756569}
review:
Fiesta Online is a terrible game. I've played this game for 10~11 years, and hardly anything has changed. Fiesta online was actually released on 2006, not 2008 as steam implies. During my time playing this game, I realized how lazy the developers actually are. You hear the same Soundtracks over again, face the same enemies (even with slightly different designs), and the game even has most of the same artwork since day one. You'd think that a game, that is 12 years old now, would have some extreme changes, but no, the way you see the game, IF you were to play it, is pretty much the same as if you played the beta. As for the gameplay, the game seems easy at say from Levels 1~89, but above those levels (Level 90~135), playing the game is Physically IMPOSSIBLE, especially if you have no friends, or are not in a guild, you can't solo at all like in any other RPGs. Reaching Level 100, you are literally forced to + up all of your armor sets (Which are 5 levels apart) if you want to actually progress and take hits, and enemies do a SHIT TON of damage, and are faster than you, so you can't really outrun them, so your fate is sealed pretty much. Also, if you die, you lose EXP (1%), and the only way to get it back is to continuously do Shitty Repeat Quests that barely give you EXP at all. Speaking of Quests, your required, accordning to  other players, to SAVE quests because some levels (Say Level 124) DO NOT give you any quests! The only reason why this game is still alive at all is because of nostalgia, and suckers like those will be willing to pay up cash to play the game. Oh yeah, speaking of "Paying up," this game has no Permanant Costumes for your character, that you would simply buy in any other game. Costumes, accessories, and pets only lasts 1 month. All in all, Fiesta is just nostalgia, that's it. It's not a good game, it's not fair, it's crazy expensive, and it's the same as it always has been. The game is literally hanging by a thread since you cannot as simply as go on to the website and download the game, OR click the shortcut to open it up, it'll just prevent you from getting online.  
Ending note: Fuck Gladiators! Your United BITCHING prevented ALL future Balance Patches from either appear or existing at all, so now the game can never be balanced in PvP or improved in PvE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064666979', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 72990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68421, 'last_played': 1604497100}
review:
Rating: 3 / 10

Put 6 years of my life into this game, was a bug tester for it for a while, and can tell you first hand that it's really bad. There are trillions of bugs in this game that cannot be fixed. The Support won't help you with any issues you might have the vast majority of the time. Some players get away with cheating, while everyone else gets banned without ever knowing why. The game is purely pay to win, you cannot do anything without purchasing their in game currency as all of the monsters in the later dungeons are balanced around having the cash shop items.

If none of these things scare you, go ahead and try it out.. The abilities for most of the classes are fairly fun to use and the animations are pretty decent, so the game isn't terribly boring. The beginning levels are really easy and can be played without purchasing anything. The game is fairly dead however, but there are still some players left. There's a lot better games where you could be spending your time however, overall I wouldn't recommend this game.

review:
Nostalgia might be a factor as to why I enjoy this game, but I've been playing on an off since I was in 7th grade. The only thing is the community isn't what is used to be, unfortunately.  One server is the most used one, the others not even comparing. It's hard to do group quests when nobody is available. 

This game is very fun. though. Patching can take a while, though, but once it's all said and done, you got a decently stable and fun mmo that holds up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170105210', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3230, 'last_played': 1522018731}
review:
I have 53 hours in this game and I haven't even been able to play a single second of it. Took me 26 hours to download the latest patch, and the 27 other hours I have been waiting for the patch to be installed. I kept the client up for more than 2 days and i'm still stuck unable to play.

Since I can't play the game to give a review, I'll review the client instead.

[h1]Fiesta Online NA Client Review[/h1]

[table]
[tr]
	[td]Graphics: ‚àû/10
[/td]
	[td]Self explanatory. I can tell the developers spent a lot of time developing the static images of their Waifus. So much time, that they forgot that their game needs to actually launch.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Sound: -12/2[/td]
	[td]I love hearing the same overly loud song over and over again for 53 hours. I just wish I could hear that song one more time. It would make my day.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Gameplay: 69/0[/td]
	[td]I can view the newswire, change settings, and even download and install a patch that will never complete all on a game that I can't even launch or play!

I also don't want to forget to mention that the launcher often crashes and refuses to respond 99% of the time. This makes for a really unforgettable and org@smic experience. No game has ever made me gave me such a thrill.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]Fun: -‚àû/42e2œÄi[/td]
	[td]If you like bankstanding in World of Warcraft or Runescape, this game is for you.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198250558954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1149, 'playtime_at_review': 34935, 'last_played': 1712366748}
review:
Analizando nuevamente a Fiesta Online, un MMORPG bastante antiguo que ha mantenido su esencia a lo largo de los a√±os, aunque no pueda dar una rese√±a en forma creo que puedo tener una opini√≥n generalizada debido a que llevo muchos a√±os jugando y conozco de manera moderada todo lo que engloba este juego.

PUNTOS A FAVOR:

+ Altamente sociable, de hecho necesitar√°s serlo si quieres crecer en este juego.

+ Sus clases son muy divertidas y es muy satisfactorio usar cada una de las habilidades de las distintas clases, sobretodo las de nivel 100+.

+ La tem√°tica de la cual se jacta de ser un  MMORPG con estilo de anime est√° bien implementada y los personajes son agradables a la vista.

+ Aunque su exploraci√≥n no es muy amplia es bastante entretenida.

PUNTOS NEGATIVOS:

- Sistema de subida de niveles altamente repetitivo y tedioso a partir de nivel 60.

- Mala optimizaci√≥n, por lo que en las ciudades principales aunque tengas un buen pc vas a sufrir bajones de FPS.

- Alto Pay2Win (En mi experiencia podr√≠a decir que es m√°s un Pay2Fast debido a que jugando puedes conseguir mucho dinero y conseguir estas mismas cosas Pay2Win, aunque pues el tiempo que tienes que dedicarle para conseguir esto es considerable).

- El primer punto a favor de sociabilidad queda un poco disminuido cuando en un mismo Server convergen muchas personas que hablan diversos idiomas, principalmente he encontrado el Ingl√©s y Espa√±ol, aunque he llegado a ver gente que habla incluso √°rabe, si este no es un problema para ti pues que mejor.

- Otro punto en contra de la sociabilidad es que en muchas ocasiones vas a encontrar tus zonas para hacer tus misiones de nivel 100+ saturadas, por lo que te sentir√°s un poco excluido y si ese no es el caso a√∫n as√≠ ser√° un impedimento para subir r√°pido, por lo que puede ser un punto negativo igualmente.

- Si te animas a descargarlo prep√°rate para una larga espera debido a que no han actualizado el parche que descargas desde no s√© hace cu√°nto tiempo, entonces te va a descargar cada uno de los parches desde ese momento hasta el d√≠a de hoy.

En general, es uno de mis juegos favoritos pese a todas sus carencias, no podr√≠a ser m√°s objetivo por que amo a este juego con todo mi coraz√≥n, sin duda alguna vale la pena darle una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156189922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1594185372}
review:
I've played this game a while back and I wanted to check it out and see how it is now.  And here's what I got from playing 7+ hours.  Downloading the game itself takes a long time. They added some nice hairs and colors and faces when you make your new characters now.  Which is nice.  The community is low.  It's hard to do kingdom party quests when there aren't many people around. My highest number of people that I've partied with for kingdom party quests is TWO.  I get disconnected sometimes during the loading screen when I get into the portal.  I get really small lag then and there.  There are way too many quests!!  There's not much to do but doing quests and grinding.  I stopped at level 24 to 25 and is an HawkArcher.  I had some small fun but it didn't last.  It just felt empty.  Not enough players to keep me playing.  

So to make it short.  It has low community and so you won't get help often.  There are way too many quests.   It's just a grinding and questing kind of game.  I get disconnected sometimes.  Lag then and there.  The whole game felt empty.   Not enough players to keep me playing.  So no I don't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226987244', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1673583143}
review:
The game is still pretty alive for a game that is this old and it is getting updates but one of the things that you will run into is the runtime error. Doesn't matter what you do it will always pop up. I looked around in the forums but apparently the only fix they have doesn't work. That's the only thing I'd like to see get fixed other than that I'm fine with the cash shop coming from FlyFF and Allods Online this cash shop isn't as bad. 

If you can stomach the runtime error that the devs don't seem to want to fix then this game should be fine for people who have lower end pcs. It is grindy but to make things easier for you all new players here is a short guide that will help you get a level 35 blue set that will help you out a ton since low level gear is hard to come by.

review: i have well over a thousand hours easily. ive been playing since i was a freshman of highschool and i graduated in 2014. the game was my first mmo and without a doubt the biggest reason i got into gaming. i made more friends than i could even count on this game! but the issue is the pay to win aspect of it. ive put thousands of dollars into the game so i could be one of the best in the game. was it worth it? not when you got mabye 600 bucks back from all the time and money you put into it. if the game ever actually was free to play and wasent putting out conent which was probably a year too early then maybe  the deticated players would come back. - Sabby <3 cypion

author: {'steamid': '76561198188545754', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5851, 'last_played': 1522676853}
review:
PROLOGUE :
I had played Fiesta from its closed beta testing days and till the cap was 79. The game feels very simple from its anime natured gameplay. I had come back to the game when Outspark (Onsonsoft licensed Outspark to run Fiesta NA servers back then) had raised the cap to 89. My sweet and faint memories of Fiesta's earliest days include guildwars between BR and GoR, pwning noobs in 10-36 Abyss and KKP with guildies.

 Oh, I remember how quick people enlisted in KQs. They were gone in a flash. Needless to say, I did spend my money on achieving the elite status. I had depended on Store to make me rich. Oh boy, It was the best feeling in the world, to pwn nubs and stroll with guildies. <Q.Q> I remember Outspark spawning Helga in Eldy and halls near it. I remember Loveless's first raid on Helga. It was just PRIDE and nothing else to actually raid helga, not weps or any other drops. The card system was basically extinct.

FIESTA BACKSTORY:

It all pretty much started with gamigo taking over, that a lot of players quit. Most of my then guildies went to Rohan online and some had shifted to Mabinogi! A couple of patches and cap raises later, mages became OP and the economy of the servers went ape-crazy. 

And yes, mainly "GAMIGO QUIT ADVERTISING FIESTA". All games need advertising to keep the game active. Server population was tremendous falling and gamigo had no actual recovery steps. Just when gifter rates went sky high, a couple of high levelers quit. That's when "FIESTA BECAME A PAY2WIN GAME". 
Fiesta's character power distribution was broken. Warlocks and Gladiators dominated PvP. Oh yeah, did I mention it's godforsaken enhancement system? Bundles of t5 are holysmoking expensive and nope that wasn't enough yet, Karen weps went for over 700 USD and were OP for PvP. 

FIESTA WASN'T DEAD YET, IT WAS BURIED IN A COFFIN ALIVE!



FIESTA CURRENT SITUATION:


TEVA AND OTHER SERVERS DIED.
Like every other fiestaholic player in my guild, I quit teva and came to Bijou. Needless to say I was still active in Teva <only at raids and PvP> Buuuuut boy, Bijou was a recovery. Although it had a broken economy, it was atleast fun to level with noobs and do low level KQ. It had about 20% population of the late Outspark Fiesta~                        T_T

Almost 95% players still play Fiesta for the relic of the game it was a couple of years back. Sure gamigo took nasty steps like banning couple of elites from forums and a few from the game <myself included> for criticizing gamigo and promoting Private Servers <NO IT WASN'T RACIAL COMMENTS, gamigo crooks really do give false statements>

Then it happened-gamigo started listening to the veterans-SERVERS MERGED.
Server merge brought back many maaannnnyyy players back, but not for long. Pagel was meant to be for mains and Isya for perms. H&G, Loveless, MK, OWA and many other top guilds turned to Pagel. Few others turned to Isya, and that was when FIESTA STARTED DYING AGAIN. MK and OWA dominated raids and shared no drops, others who wanted to be part of raiding system couldn't help but turn to Isya, so they wanted an out. <ISYA HAD THE RAIDING SYSTEM OF A 4-YEAR OLD> Gifters left and again Pagel became Teva. 

The game is still fun, you can get to 70 in a week. Server economy is decent and needless to say FIESTA IS STILL A PAY2WIN. Buuttt, heey it's atleast FUN. 
Fiesta just isn't that game where you can sell your +ed weps gears and buy higher lvl +ed weps gears again with the same money and effort. FIESTA IS A TIME SINK FOR VETERAN PLAYERS and yes mostly FIESTA WILL DRAIN YOUR WALLET DRY.

I do recommend fiesta to players because It is still FUN albeit demanding. I do know Fiesta is dying but it still is amazing all the while. On the flip side, it has survived a lot more compared to Rohan, Mabinogi and other MMORPGs. -_-

If you're that player who cares about every cent you've earned, forget you read this and search for another F2P game out there xD

Ciao~

author: {'steamid': '76561198353324704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1514654519}
review:
I Played back in '08 When I was very young, At the time, It was pretty damn great, and was ran by a Company called Outspark. I played for years, enjoying myself despite not even making much progress, then I kinda phased out of it. I've been on here and there for Nostalgia reasons and the game is dying. It's sad. It's very simplistic and fun, but that was also when servers had hundreds to thousands of players each, now theres only a few hundred on at a time across all servers. If you told me someone could revive this game and keep its simplistic nature, I'd be playing consistently in a heartbeat. Overall, many games are blatantly better, but it holds a special place in my heart.

Fuck Gamigo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103212801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5578, 'last_played': 1574535209}
review:
on steam ive only put in 75.5hrs because i just got into it again but before the merge and back when the game was popular i put well over 2k hrs into this game. I have a 104 fighter, 73 archer and a 108 mage before i quit (back when the cap was 115) and a 103 cleric too bad its on a dead server.

To begin there are 4 servers that you can play on, only 1 is "active" so you really only have option to play one server.

the main towns arent nearly as packed as they used to be but they not nearly as dead as everyone makes it out to be.

THIS IS A P2W kind of game, as in to make your weps stronger you need bundles to decrease the chance to break and such (really needed over +3 upgrade) some items are pure cosmetic but there are way more that give defense,attack and evasion,ect boosts aswell as hp extenders and damage boosts so take that as you will. You dont need to put money to enjoy the game but it does make it easier/ more fun.

everyone in the game is pretty friendly but there are still alot of "vets" who are cringy as fk so take that as you will

So overall it is pretty fun still with or without money and alot to do with or without people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099433219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1512672217}
review:
I'm a veteran player, back from 10~ish years ago when Outspark ran the game.

It's your standard, run-of-the-mill K-MMORPG.  If you're filthy weeaboo trash like me and enjoy emptying your wallet's green load all over anime waifus, you'll probably love this game.  

This game has been, and continues to be, one of the biggest money traps of a game I've ever experienced.  Even more so, now that the community has more or less died (only remaining players are people like me - sad people who have spent too much time to let go and keep playing for nostalgia).  So if you want to solo in the high levels, enjoy spending exorbitant amounts of money on charms and EXP boosts - that way you can spend TWELVE hours running in circles kiting giant snakes for 1/800th of a % of a level, instead of spending SIXTEEN hours. Profit!

Community is virtually dead and 95% of current players seem to be perpetually stuck in 2006.  Most unironically overuse phrases and symbols like:

1) XD
2) &&
3) :3 
4) Replacing "the" with "teh" because it's kawaii~desu
5) Rawr XD

Not to mention, the entire game often comes off as an enormous harem.  People in game take their virtual marriages VERY seriously and spend REAL MONEY to make sure everyone knows how madly in "luff" they are with their spouses every 10-15 minutes in global chat.  Who said romance is dead?

Game is extremely buggy and crashes constantly if you do literally anything at all, including important tasks like opening the map! (I  guess it's a good thing only vets play! At least they know where everything is.  Probably better than they know the inside of their own homes, exceptions being maybe the basement.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054966506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 37724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17512, 'last_played': 1690716892}
review:
Sorry about my cookie cutter grammar.

For the past 11 years i've played games similar to fiesta such as Flyff, Cloud nine, the guild wars series in a way, and World of warcraft, It's a shame they all have something in common in the end now.

MMorpgs and roleplaying online games are dying out now because they are not unique like they used to be anymore. Specific skills, armors, traits, weapons, classes used to set all these games on a different path from one another.We used to have storylines or gameplay that made sence not some stupid quick made up world that made it easy for everyone to play a game or have some infinite way to beat everyone all the time by paying money out of pocket.

This game used to be good "Used to be" due to the team of Developers that actually cared to correct mistakes made by code or glitches made due to patches. It "used to have" a team of devs that gave two blown transmissons about the community and cared what atleast some players said.People are begging for a server transfer because when gamigo bought it out they messed up the merge and didnt just hand out free transfers to give all our mains a chance to transfer to the "Real active server" regardless of the tool being released twice and then shot down.

The veterans who missed out on their email warnings with a 2 week warning to choose what server to transfer got shafted if they joined too late, and wanted to come back for old times.

Games developers today care about nothing but money.I used to play games in a time where gameplay made us all curious, it used to make us dream about what we could become in game and seeing those become what you wanted and see better places we could have gone no one else had, items that set us apart from everyone else, not made it an equal playing field for everyone and a simple mindless skill clicking quest repeating cookie cutter game.

People used to help each other out not care about being better.

The games are dying because nothing today sets them aside like what Guild Wars, or Flyff used to, They all had their niche no other company could touch in gameplay and ending up going down the same road, it makes me wonder what really happend to our community over all.

I wish some day someone would stand up against all the boring expected gameplay and rushed game creation we have today that appeals to the masses and focus on telling them we need something unique that can be carried another 10 or 20 years like world of warcraft was, or like "Fiesta" "Was" or what flyff was in it's prime.

This game is "What is left" and now thats all it will ever be. and to be the best here now, you have to pay out of pocket and can't even set up a sale store without random disconnections, or run through a town/portal without runtimes. Even with it's multiple login attempts, and different feel to it overall that sets it aside from every other game i've played and is now shut down, this is going down that same road again like the rest. 

But is it worth returning regardless of having nothing left, That is up to you to decide, but I can't return anymore to a community that is begging for help from the developers that recline, step back, and keep waiting for it to end up like the rest.

I enjoyed this game from 2009 to late 2012, and I actually can't wait to see it shutdown, something I hate to say but feel is right in the current state it is in, or some major, major implimentations need to be made to fix common bugs everyone has been asking to be fixed for years now to bring back  some of whats left of the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136027140', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 67661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64007, 'last_played': 1627416975}
review: Ah, the days of this game. I've known Fiesta Online since I was 12, and fwoooo has this game's development gone for a ride. Though I still play Fiesta from time to time, and even capped my character when it was 125, I cannot hit the yes on recommend because for new players... There's not much to see. Most of the player base are those of us who have been with the game for years and still love it despite the many flaws, but for new players Fiesta is nothing but a mess. The first 60 levels are far too frickin easy now, and entering the 60+ zone has a huge difficulty inbalance as that room of zombies will eat you up faster than Majin Buu if you don't have a proper team. But as said, this is only a problem for the newbies as old players already know what to expect from this crazy world, and likely have equipment and money around to support themselves. The biggest problem though lies in the fact that the devs... Just can't get everything done. We've had nice updates that made leveling faster and all, but I recently read a post saying they had no model artists on hand to fix an issue. Updates are constantly being announced and cancelled, or just forever delayed (that merge though). I could go on abot pay2win drama, but we've probably all already experienced free online games and know all about that s*bleep*tstorm. Oh yeah, and the community can be close and friendly, but also scary in that sense. If you mess with ANYBODY, you could end up on some player wanted lists and what not. Though personally I've never had issues with this as I'm a lovely perfect angel ^u^ (95% of the time), but I can see it driving some players away with headaches. Gameplay wise, be warned that Fiesta does not hold back with difficult bosses, at all. Though many dungeons became a lot easier with the lvl entry update, don't let the cute slimes and adorable hobo men of the early levels fool you. You'll get your squishy tush torn to shreds by the demons, beasts, and uhhh... bigger slimes of the high levels! And glitches, lots of them, fwoo! But that goes with the development issues. Overall, Fiesta is a game that still holds a place in my heart, and I'll still hop on from time to time when the devs give us those surprisingly decent updates (they exist whether the community admits it or not). But it pains me that I cannot recommend it to new players. This game will likely stay a gem for the old until the server eventually shuts down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042181185', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1499265437}
review:
I've finally made myself write this.
Fiesta Online was a bumpy road. Absolutely amazing gameplay that rivaled World of Warcraft: WotLK, and while the "anime" aspect can be annoying if you hate anime, you couldn't deny the community was close-knit and happy, as well as the moderators were fun and would take the time to get to know you one on one. That was when Outspark developed the game. Sales, events, and patches were frequent and the game was at the top MMOs list. Then, Outspark disappeared and "Gamigo" replaced it. Let me tell you now. GAMIGO IS THE WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER SEEN. They lost my account of $400+ purchased items during their transfer from Outspark to Gamigo servers, and their support was horrendous. Two weeks apart from each response and each was some broken english telling me to "change your email" or "change your password" or "we will allow you to change your username this once" to "fix it", when they never did. Still haven't recovered my account. While I soaked years into this game (At least 5600+ hours), now it's just dead, sad, full of people from other regions so nobody speaks English, and unfun. Not to mention all my accounts are gone and those months of grinding items and filling 5+ pages of my bank with rares and legendaries to give to new or learning players. I miss tutoring new people, giving out free stuff, chatting with mods in game, doing events with mods, and more. This game will always have a place in my heart. Rest in peace Fiesta Online.

EDIT: Contacted support and they finally gave me access back to my "account". I logged in to find that everything I had was missing from every single server. They carried over my "account", sure, but no characters, items, or my inventory. Nothing. Contacted them again and got this: 
"If you are currently missing characters, this is probably due to an issue that we currently have with the Migrator Script that is currently not working properly. 
Due to that, your characters have not been properly moved to the new servers of Fiesta Online NA. 
Our IT team is already working on a solution and once the latter has been applied, you should be able to connect on your characters again.
We kindly ask you to be bit more patient. "
Okay, so, for 4 years now (Gamigo obtained the game in early 2013) the so-called Migrator script has not been working? It's 2017 and you still have accounts that aren't migrated. That's pretty sad, and it's not like I wasn't active before the changes, because you can tell when an account was last online (like most standard games these days). This is pretty unacceptable and infuriating for people that were there from the start and are now getting royally fucked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350535886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1489300661}
review:
This is a bit of a tough decision for me to make. I'm going to reccomend this game, but only for veterans and rich people.
I've been playing Fiesta Online since 2010, so this game gives me so much nostalgia that it's almost impossible to leave. Quitting cigarettes would be easier than leaving this bad Jackson.
But honestly ever since Gamigo took over it's been nearly impossible to do anything because a lot of players have left, the prices have risen, and absolutely nobody wants to help anybody anymore. There's a few tight-knit guilds left on the two servers that people actually play on, but it's still difficult since they're not always available to help you.
I guess what I'm trying to say here is that I would not reccomend this game for people who aren't willing to spend at least $20 monthly on it, because you're going to need it, and you'll probably spend more because it's honestly like cocaine.

Okay thank you for reading my extremely unorganized review.

review:
I've played this insane game for like 3-4 years while under ownership of outspark.
It was a good game, if not for the buff beggars (people who are too damn lazy to do things on their own and have to demand or cry for buffs to go out and grind.  these are a rare occurance in other mmorpgs and i will not oblige these...creatures as a cleric.) and the whiners who just beg for money and sometimes insult you if you refuse them other than the demons of this mmorpg the game is ok.. if not dated by today's standards, from last i played i recall a slight graphical and map improvement.  the item mall is a little pay-y to win-y, but i can only sing the praises of the 7 day EXP card, lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198003869004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1628893161}
review:
An mmo with a anime look to it. This game starts off pretty slow and leveling up is also pretty slow. You can increase the speed at which you level up by purchasing in game items for real money in the online store. 

The game is very grindy and can get boring after a while. If you are going in this game as a solo player it will get boring very fast. It is best to party up with some people or bring some of your real life friends to this game with you and you all can share the experience. It still does get boring after a while but not as fast as if you were playing this by yourself.

I originally played this game when it first came out before it was ever on STEAM. I leveled a cleric up to level 90 over the course of off and on gameplay for about 2 years. If you want to level up to max level you would have to play at least an hour a day, every day and not mess around and go straight to questing and grinding. Doing that it would take you about a month maybe. IF you really try you can get max level in 2 weeks but you have to invest a lot of time in the game everyday.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092886759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 9069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8554, 'last_played': 1465255267}
review: This was my first MMO love and throughout the years I've come and gone. I've decided now to stay gone for good. This is certainly pay to win and towards the end of the game, pay to play (in a sense). The economy is totally broken and unless you are willing to invest hundreds of real-life dinero into this game, stay away. It's sad to say I do not recommend this game to anyone.
