author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1468266814}
review:
Fiesta Online NA is a free to play MMORPG that started in 2007.  It worked, sounded ok, looked ok, played ok, was understandable.  Had some sort of tutorial help pages. Has anime styled world and characters with cel shaded graphics and cute stuff.

 IMHO, a terrible starting character experience. Having started an Archer, i had no money, no gear,  having no starter bow and no starter archer skills. Skills cost copper money.  Found a several quests to attack i guess begginning critters using hand attacks. 2 had rewards for hat and boots.  Looking in the steam forum and negative review saying this game is highly Pay to win.   

I didn't like this game, try it if you want to pay real money to win.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ecTbOprYqcU

http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/fiesta-online

http://www.freemmogamer.com/review/fiesta-online/

http://mmohuts.com/news/fiesta-online-review/

http://www.onrpg.com/games/fiesta-online-us/

author: {'steamid': '76561198050350770', 'num_games_owned': 1139, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1491873942}
review:
This was my first MMO. I started it when I was 10 and played it for about a year and a half. In that time I met many good friends. Some of which I still speak to today. The game provided a very fun outlet for me for a little over 900 hours. I played this before it was on steam though. So my hours aren't necessarily shown here. I played when the game was owned by Outspark. The community is really nice and helpful and the game has good progression, good dungeons to crawl with other players. Though I'm not sure how populated the game is now. Overall very fun if you find a few friends to play it with or make friends along the way. Im recommending this from biased nostalgia. Because it was fun and I enjoyed it. I would most likely still be playing it if I could figure out what happened to my account after they switched owners and websites. 

PS. The nostalgia factor with this game is strong. I miss a ton of my old friends that I lost when I lost my account. Most notably DarkArcher97.

EDIT: I just realized they now paywalled a lot of things ingame :/. Not cool. Changing my recommendation because of this. Why must devs try to suck cash out of everything?!?!

review:

LOVE the new mechanic of accepting and turning in quests in the field, back then it was always go back and forth which made leveling up a lot slower. Still popular on certain servers and I find I need to take breaks from it because it still feels so old because I'm used to the new high end online games like World of Warcraft and Planetside 2 (I know Planetside 2 is a different style of online game but still).

author: {'steamid': '76561198227141756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1481851804}
review:
This is a bad game stay away!!!!!!! 
I'm veteran of this game been playing since almost the start, now its dead.                                (my hours are low because  I only added it to steam to comment)
What made me do this review is gamigo the current company and staff
After paying $400USD only for custom costume items which were promised in 2 months
me and everyone else who ordered the items are still waiting its 5-6 months overdue. 
Some more points about the game bellow, but i recommend you don't try this game or quit if you still play things will only go down hill untill the servers close. 
- pay to win
- pvp is based on cash shop items ( the more you spend the higher your stats)
- pve is highly repititive ( almost no updates, new content comes every 1- 2 years)
- low player base 100-200 people on the main servers rest of the servers are really dead.
- need to pay money to be able to do raids/farm properly 
- bad graphics 
- no end game content  
- grind heavy 
- bad staff
- updates and deadlines constantly not kept 
- have to spend money each month to be able to play well 50$s+
- no value for money

Just stay away its not worth it.

review: This game used to be beautiful before GameGo took over. Off of steam I have thousands of hours played. For social and non social reasons. But now, a lot of it is dead servers, rushed quests, crappy kingdom quests which NOBODY does anymore. The only reason anyone really plays anymore is for the social aspect. Nobody plays to really level, because getting from level 1-105 now can take an hour or two. Powerleveling is legal now, gifting is legal now, nobody gets in trouble for scamming that I know of, the game kinda just went to crap when GameGo took over and it's a real shame. This game used to be wonderful and beautfiul with gorgeous quests and so much effort was put into it for no good reason accept for fun. Now Fiesta is just like any private server there is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168798746', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 7160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5896, 'last_played': 1526311690}
review:
I've been playing this on and off for 13 years ( that's how old the NA servers are ). Outspark first owned it until the early 2010's when the sold it to another company . 

There are 6 classes ( 1 you need to unlock a toon at cap level )
Cap level is 135 ( will be higher in 2021 )
You can make your own guild PVE or PVP . 
There are caves you can PVP in . 
Many many towns you can go into 
Making money by selling gears , materials , potions and scrolls. 

There is an item mall in the main fiesta website . They use slime coins as currency on there. 

Highly recommended for the MMORPG genres.

HOWEVER....ONSONSOFT just sold Gamigo the entire rights to gamigo themselves...meaning we can finally spread our wings. I think they are going to do a great job...as they have and it has been a month so far. OOS was a major restriction when it came to the game. Cross your fingers :)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054084542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1454832798}
review:
I have sunk a few years into this game. I originally had it before it came out on Steam, and the only reason I got it through steam was because I stopped playing and uninstalled it at one point. It was originally owned by a company called Outspark, and it hasn't changed all that much since it switched over to Gamigo. Mostly skin changes for monsters and the starter town.. oh and maybe some NPCs. 

In terms of classes, it doesnt really matter what you pick since all the quests are the same. There is no story line whatsoever. There are seasonal events, and the premium item store holds some goodies if you are willing to spend real cash in order to get store currency. It has been said that FO has become a pay to win game, but as long as you're willing to put in the hours, it is possible to reach cap without premium items. I dont suggest battlefields, pvp dungeons or PVP kingdom quests without premium items... which I guess proves the pay to win section.

The enhancement system is also a lot harder if you dont use premium items, and even though enhancement offers some perks, and makes your gear prettier... it is still possible to play without, or you can always farm/sell for in game currency and hope to buy off another player. Players stores can be ridiculously priced though.. unfortunately people dont really offer an item for what it's really worth and tend to overprice useless gear. Be mindful of your class and stats before buying from other players, and really consider whether it is actually worth the price.

It has its pros and cons like any game, but if you're into things like this then by all means give it a go. It's not so bad, as long as you're willing to sink hours into it. (Though... if memory serves... since I havent started a new character in a very long time... you can get to level 30 within a couple hours)

author: {'steamid': '76561198121080946', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 137089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 502, 'playtime_at_review': 79789, 'last_played': 1711918248}
review:
Bueno este juego lo conosco desde uff hace a√±os hace poco lo pusieron a steam y lo volvi a jugar.
El juego es divertido mas que nada por el pvp subir nivel para equiparte farmear tus set's (armadura) encantarlas para tener mas da√±o / def exelente el juego.

Lo Bueno:
Las armas se pueden encantar y asi conseguir el mas da√±o posible
Las armaduras se pueden encantar y asi conseguir la maxima defensa posible
Las monturas se pueden encantar para andar por las ciudades mas rapido de lo normal
Tiene 6 Clases para escojer
Apariencia anime
Raid's difiles de hacer
Excelente PVP
Existe la forma de casarte con un personaje
Demaciados trajes de apariencia y skins de armas con da√±o
Trades / Tiendas y Mas!

Lo Malo:
Pay 2 Win
Al encantar las armas/armaduras se pueden romper se necesita un item de pago!
Los mounts o monturas se compran con dinero real
Los sets costume se compran por 7 o 30dias con dinero real
Las Skins de armas tienen durabilidad y para repararlas necesitas comprar un item si no se rompe mas aparte las skins de da√±o se compran con dinero real
Las personalizacion de cabello y rostro cuesta dinero real
Para casarse se necesita dinero real
Para hacer raid o farmear necesitas tener tu traje encantado o comprar charm's (buff da√±o/def) de pago!
Practicamente todo es de pago asi que si quieres jugarlo y tienes dinero este es tu juego

a mi pareser es muy divertido el juego tengo 1.413.7h y eso que los demas a√±os que lo jugue no estaba en steam hehehe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213530009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1795, 'last_played': 1574640009}
review:
I used to play this back in like 2005, When a company named Outspark had owned it.  It's jumped around owner-ship a little bit after Outspark sold it.  I believe it's on it's 4th owner but, I have so much nostalgia for this game it's insane.  

I miss the old bustling community, but even so Isya has a large player base still left. 

[b] Don't install on steam, install through their website [/b] 

The steam version of this game is horrendous and annoying to deal with. 
If I could review this game as Neutral I would, I'd play it if you were interested in giving it a shot.  

 Just know it is old and mildly P2W, Once you get into later game if you want good stats you'll want to upgrade your gear like in Black Desert if [i]YOU[/i] have played that. 
 There are some XP and Bag upgrades in the Premium shop, aswell as some items that make it almost impossible for the item you are upgrading to break/decrease.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008902802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1687171192}
review:
If you're an old player returning to fiesta out of nostalgia, keep in mind that its not the same game anymore. Leveling isnt as hard as it used to be, and quests feel rushed. It feels like rather than increasing the exp rate of the game, Gamigo decided to add more, seemingly meaningless quests which give ridiculous amounts of exp. You can accept and turn in quests without even being near the NPC you got it from. This does mean that the "pay to level" system of the older outspark game is gone, but it doesnt feel as satisfying to level (I hit level 60 in 3 days, whereas it used to be a huge achievement). The Trickster felt like Outsparks final attempt to reinvigorate the game before they turned it over to gamigo. And gamigo responded by adding the Crusader, a class which seems so rushed that it doesnt even exist below level 60, and it even has some skills copy pasted from other classes.
I can see that Gamigo are really trying to update and reinvent the game, with graphics updates, new quests, and a quicker leveling system, which allows you to get into the action faster. It even merged all the servers into a couple of servers to make the servers full of people again. As a result, this isnt the same game as it used to be, but its an evolving, fun game nonetheless.

Ultimately, this isnt the golden '105 cap' fiesta that I remember, but I'm not gonna say it isn't worth playing. While its not the game I poured endless hours of my childhood into, its still a good game. Fiesta used to be hailed as a "pay to win" game, but now more than ever I feel that this isnt true. You can do really well without paying a cent. Im going to miss the days of stacking, endless grinding and massive guild raids on Karen, but the game is still fun. If you're coming to revive an old interest, you may be better off on a private server. But if you're willing to try a new game, this will be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103939631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1579479342}
review: even though i have no play time on steam i have played this game before it was bought out by the new owners Gamigo. sadly after it was bought over i lost all access to my account and could no longer play with my account so i eventually stoped. but before that the game was fun to play and enjoyable with my friends and guild. there are some times in which it would take forever to lvl and it would lose its luster but as an old player this game was fun so if your looking for a okay mmo to play this one would work. sadly this game lacks in the character creation department and you have to use real cash to buy cosmetic changes. so its a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198069972927', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1482716906}
review: Game used to be awesome. Like 2008 or 2009, when Outspark owned it. I probably had like 3000+ hours on it. There was like 200k - 1 million players on everyday (probably exaggeration, but it felt like there were that many players). I would play it everyday with my brother and a lot of the friends I made on that game. There were always events, dance parties and the kingdom quests were so full, you had to be quick just to get in. But then the switch to gamigo brought the player base to like 100 players and now they did a merge that erased my friends list, my marriage and spouse, and seperated my characters so my main character is on a different server and I lost all my cash and stored items. Good shit. But honestly I still love this game because it was a big part of my childhood. But it's outdated now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127594689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1473515221}
review: I remember when this game used to be extremely fun in the 09-10 era. A lot of friendly people who weren't always selfish or shy were everywhere, and really entertaining soundtracks would always set the mood when seeing people fight monsters, but now it's a really depressing game. Unless you have played games that are similar to Fiesta ( like Rift, Warcraft, Eldevin, etc.) you are going to be bored and the atmosphere of the game may ruin your fun. I don't even think it's going to be fun if you have friends playing WITH you. Overall, I wouldnt recommend it, unless the game gets a major re-work to when it honestly wasn't Pay-To-Fucking-Win. (Note: I played this game on the client in 2009 before the game was handed over to Gamigo [When i realized the game's fun dropped dramatically] and logged on about 100 hours, so if anyone has any questions or does not feel like i have the experience in this game to write a review, I just wanted to let you know I did spend a lot of time playing the game. Man i loved the Clerics.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141953780', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1443499905}
review:
I'll start by saying that I played this game from 2007-2009 and that was the time to play. Every server had lots of people and the economy was thriving!

Also, I played more than 27 hours. I found that steam makes this game crash so. I downloaded the client from the Gamigo website.

I heard about a server merge and figured I'd download it to check it out. They just merged the servers they had into 4 new servers; so, it's just like when I started there were 4 servers. When I left the game in 2009, they had 6 servers and I don't know if there were more added between 2009-2015. 

They would have to merge the 4 servers they have now into one to even get 1/2 of the number of people they had on just one server in 2009. 

Don't let the population reading confuse you. Two of the servers say medium population when they should say "very low" Don't get me started on the ghost towns that are the servers that say low...

I played up to lv 62 and I couldn't do any kingdom quests because no one else was playing them. This is one of the main reasons that I quit in 2009 because you need materials to craft and the best way to get them in through KQ's but if no one wants to play then the game really becomes a grind!. 

The only kingdom quest that was going was the level 105+ one and it was not even full. 

I saw some people desperately shouting for people to join the KKP level 70-79 KQ the one that I loved the most. These were some of the shouts.

Join KKP mats <3
Please Please Please join KKP
JOIN KKP FOR MATS WE DO HAVE A CLERIC!!!!

The people are not that bad they just seem to me to be trying too hard to hold on to this game when they know it's on its already dead. The people I met were mostly nice they helped me out more because they wanted to show off their cash shop godly powers than any other reason.

I was being run through this dungeon tower for Lvl 20+ toons by a Lvl 60. The whole time we when in there he was saying things like I can do 4000+ damage with these charms. (Charms are cash shop items that increase your damage for a set amount of time) He must have been wearing 60$ or more worth of cash shop items. I got the feeling that this guy had this toon set up to run people through this tower never letting the toon get past level 60. This is a common practice in all MMO's but, I just found it amazing that this person was still doing it on this game considering its population. I'm sure I was one of the only people he had helped in a long time.

Now on to the economy, to start, let's talk about guild academies! At least the two that I joined, were giving rewards of 1-10 gold per level. The academy that I mainly stayed in was "Eradicate" -- the one with the best rewards.

 I made 10g the last level "60" for a total of 2gems and 30 gold that's more than I ever had before. Guess what? I still could not afford anything for my toon the prices are insane now. I saw one good weapon priced at 7 Gems or 700 Gold. This was a level 70 weapon not even enhanced or anything. I started talking to the guy and asked if he would come down on the price he said one simple word "NO" 

The economy on this game now if based on everyone believing that everyone else has a secret level 100+ toon where the quests alone can make you a millionaire.

What really finally bashed the nailing into the coffin for me was today 10/9/15, I spent 20$ in the store on enhancement bundles this way my weapon would not break as I was leveling it up. 

I bought 3 of the T3 Bundles for 20$. I had already enhanced my ax to +4 the max limit before it will break if I try again without shop items. I used all 30 of the protection items and only got my ax to +10..... now remember it was already +4 when I started.... the max is +11 I spent 40g and 8 of those protection items just trying to get my ax from 10 to 11 the price is too high for me. A sub to World of Warcraft is 15$ a month and there are no paid in-game items except for looks on that game. 

I would have to spend 50, 60, maybe even 70$+ just to get my ax to +11 and armors to +10 anyone who says you can do it without ever enhancing your items has never played the game. Or, they played the game when there were 1000's of other people playing it and you could get a party if you sucked. I decided to let this game go and wish anyone who is addicted to it well. I hope you see what you are doing to yourself before you waste your life away like I did this past week.

I try to think of it this way

Say I keep on playing past level 62, The good thing is that it's possible to get to Lvl 70 just from quests. But then what,  Say I   spend the rest of the week getting to lv 70. Ok, I'm now level 70, so, I start getting to 80, and leveling starts to slow down as there are no kingdom quests. 

The quests offer 10-50% of the required XP per level. So, I grind for the next few months to get to 100+, then what? Now I'm a level 100+ toon and now what?? I can get all the money that I need by doing quests and play 1 kind of KQ. I can hang out with my "Friends" most of whom will be decked out in cash shop items. These people won't want me in their circle unless I spend money on the cash shop too... say I do spend money on the cash shop then what??? I'm now a level 100+ toon with godly stats that is accepted by his peers who spent 100's if not 1000's of $$$ and can do 1 kind of KQ if my "friends" feel like doing it too. I can go on raids if my "friends" feel like doing it too...

There is no future for me playing this game. However, if what I just summed up seems like your kinda fun, then download now and enjoy!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198171707551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13244, 'last_played': 1681671215}
review:
I have played this game a lot. i currently have 192 hours mostly on my archer level 76. This game has really good combat in my opinion because the skills and healing with sp/mana hp/sp pots and stones is really fun and different from most games of the genre. It has a really good core idea with lots of little funny and odd anime stories but i have more complaints then things I like.
       I said that I really like the combat which in a very grindy game is a must need. You dont have a million abilities but you have enough to keep you interested. I like that the balance is really good because there are a lot of buffs you can do to your character. You more often then not will have scrolls or potions on that increase your stats tiers 1-5 that can all be created through crafting and receiving from quests. The stat system is very normal and well made. The game has lots of different cool thins like your mini house. You reviece a mini house that over time restores your hp and sp over time from sitting in this mushroom that you can change the look of the higher levels you reach. Now on to the bad things.
       This game has a decent structure I think with a few personal things gamigo has come up with with cool buff systems and healing items to keep you in battle. But there are a few things that make this game absolutely atrocious at times. I am not sure what level it starts happening at (around level 50 I think) when you die you loose hard earned xp. Ok this seems ok sure you die and you loose like 5% of your base xp FINE. But this game was made so that when you level up you get a certain amount of quests for the next level and if you die to many times durring that level you are suck having to grind or do "repeat quests" which are quests that give next to no xp which are very grindy and take forever to do just so you can get the last 10% of your xp bar to level up and get a new set of quests to go grind more mobs. They try to cover up the flaw by giving you the "repeat quests". Another thing is the economy... THERE IS NO SUCH THING because the way you can sell items to other players is by setting up a mini house and selling your items in a stationary spot which means if you wanna sell things you have to be online. And instead of playing while your online which the makes should be emphasizing you sometimes just have to get on and go afk all day to make money. 
       If gamigo would just let as keep our xp when we die and come up with an auction house or somethign like world of warcraft then you would be afloat i think.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966074900', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 7925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1685840772}
review:
I am going to have a hard to recommending this game. I have played it before for a lot of hours before it was ever on steam. The game is VERY grindy and almost all the qests are the same really. Go kill "X" Monster and collect "x item". If it is not a monster then it is "go pick "X" plant and bring it back". It also doesn't help that it is pay to win as you can buy power ups with real money that are temporary. What makes it even worse is most stuff is only temporary. You get 5 vendor slots unless you buy a sign of tycoon which is tempoary. I now find most of my time in the game making scrolls and potions and selling them because it does get boring. What makes it even worse is the game seems to crash... a lot so even selling stuff can be hard as you cannot just set it up and go afk... if you do, you pray you don't come back a few hours later to see it crash. 

Currently, I cannot recommend this game. The populations on the servers is often low, too repedative, too grindy and too unstable. If it improves over time, this may change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046565043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1436050310}
review:
Oh Fiesta Online you bring back me back. Back to when I knew so little about MMORPGs and introduced me to a world of fantasy,adventure, long time friends....and sucking my wallet dry! 

Now this is a story all about how
this game will make your funds go down
the nostalgia is gone this game will set a flame
I'll tell you how why you shouldn't bother to get this game

Welcome to fiesta! Create your character! We have many options for you to try!
Oh what's that? There‚Äôs only three? We we have way more but you need to buy!
Its just a small fee, maybe 5 bucks or ten!
And then you'll never have to worry about it again... >.> (but if you change your mind you'll have to pay again)

Time to play the game and now you're in your first raid
Now look at all the the players that paid
They're stronger, better and can take a hit
Their costumes look awesome while you look like shit

Now now don't be sad and throw a fit
All you have to do is buy this kit
its full of great power ups and costumes galore
but because its bundled you'll have to pay a little more

There ya go, just look at you, hanging with the best
You rule this game now so stick out your chest!
But oh no.. what this? your shiny gear is gone?
Well you only got the small pack and it doesn't last long..

But now if you want the permanent kind
just pay a little more and just keep in mind
that permanent power ups are very rare
so buy them fast before they fade into thin air

Oh nice, lucky you, you found a great weapon
and you want to improve it for better protection
but if you want to make sure that it doesn't get destroyed
then pay a little more so you can fully enjoy...

Wait! What's wrong? Where are you going!?
I know it seems a lot that you are owing...
Fine! Forget you!  You can see my sin...
I got all your money and you can't even log in!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016815931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1433975874}
review:
This game is terribly uninteresting; its very generic and, well, devoid of anything that stands out. There's also a ton of bugs, funny Engrish, and wait times (I spent half my play time waiting for it to patch), though, so if playing bad games is your thing, by all means enjoy.

In the end, I'd recommend you get Yandere Sim instead. At least that has entertainment value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176054685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7080, 'last_played': 1497236247}
review: So I've gone through and read all the reviews and a lot of them consist of comments such as "I USED to love and have fun playing this game but....[insert whatever reason]" and I just wanted to put my two cents in. I am one of those players back in 2010. It was amazing I've made a lot of bonds/friends in that game spent countless hours of fun chatting/gameplay. Maybe I am trying to cling on to old memories of good times but at the same time I do not want this game to die. For those of you who did have a good time in the past I beseech you to come back and play again. Gamigo isn't perfect but at least they are trying listen and cooperate with the communities. Development is slow but please give it time I know things will get better. The server merge will help repopulate the game and as of right now all the "jerk" players from earlier in the game are gone. I've found that because the community is smaller everyone is a bit more tight knit and therefore helpful/friendly. There's barely ever any drama.  I haven't seen much of people screaming of being scammed or wanting to be gifted. etc. I know this was once a great game and I know it can also be it once again please don't give up on it and download this game to play it for old times sake. :D If anyone is ever on the (soon to be Isya/Epith server find me and I'll help you out to the best I can. "TrustMeImADoctor" ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198043707821', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1454982050}
review:
I remember playing this game back in the day when I was but a wee boy.  I remember loving this game and spending hours and hours online with a  community that was actually a joy to be apart of. One day, I just stopped playing Fiesta, and moved on with other games. 

When I saw that Fiesta had found its way to steam, I was surprised to see it was still alive. I'm not sure how its still around, considering how bland and repetitive it is. It's your typical Korean mmo grind fest with an uninspired tab targeting combat system and a pay 2 win cashshop.

I guess the only thing that would keep someone around would be the community. Its a shame there isn't one anymore. The game feels dead and empty.  At one point in time, areas that would be bustling with activity and parties  are now nothing more than barren maps with the occasional mob of enemies here or there. From what Ive seen, the towns are dead, say for the few newcomers who downloaded the game out of curiosity. I can only assume the sight of an empty starting town won't keep them playing for very long.

Fiesta kind of reminds me of the world in Dark Souls.  It's past its prime, and its waiting for the end to come. But in Fiesta's case, it's seems like the sooner that happens. the better

author: {'steamid': '76561198016200917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 60025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28462, 'last_played': 1708573196}
review:
I do no recommend Fiesta Online to anyone, it's an obvious skinner box attack to its users, Pve you are not really wanted at high levels unless you are gracing with cash shop items that give really unfair advantages in a game where most bosses involves the drops be given to the highest dps party. And pvp is no fun cause of what I am about to say in next paragraph

From 50% additional hp, 70% additional damage and armor, 20% more damage from weapon skins,  80% crit rates [crits are double damage], 50% additional item drop rates, Instant full hp, no cd potion, 100% xp rates. Everything is monetized, if there is an advantage you can get there is a thing to buy.

I played years  back, maybe 7 years ago, cash shop was mainly used as a consmetic items, maybe some had crit rates but were very minute, i remember a crit set [full cash shop items] having a whopping 3% crit, now its nothing to see people rolling with 80% crit rates.

The perm [never leveling] community is what made me wanna stick around, The farming of gears is actually a really fun aspect to me, it's all random statted and I am a collector at heart, i got near all max statted sets and the perm community on Epith never used cash shop, we were really all free to play outside of enhaching our sets. 

This is where I am now, it's a terrible community thats filled with people buying items for hundreds of dollars, through facebook groups. Pvp has turned into people obtaining the best items by paying real money for them, if you dont buy the items you spend cash shop points to obtain items so that you may gain gold faster, if you are true free to play you can not make the gold another thats spending hundreds selling his cash shop or just flat out buy items for real money, You will not outbid other pvpers for the best items cause some has spent thousands of dollars to obtain un heard amounts of in game money.

The drop rates are terrible, beyond bad, even with cash shop items that boosts rates its not fun at all, It wasnt always like this. The ratio of gears farmed to gears that people want is too low, the low drop rates has forced a sellers market that items are so rare that they can decide how much they want for it, where as if drop rates were increased and alot of that item was available it be buyers market where people undercut each other to sell theirs. Guess who gets to buy gears? You guessed it the people that spend real money, you will not succeed if you do not spend you will not have a good time if you do not spend, Do not be used as a skinner rat [ google search skinner box technique] Cause playing this game you will become one

review:
So Horrible!!! At first it was OK with the Tutorial, but when I started a real quest it screwed up back. I tried auto-walking to the NPC and it took me to another area, to a specific portal, where I would stop walking. I then tried auto-walk to NPC from there and it took me in a circle through another portal and back to the first one. After about 4 or 5 times of that. one of the portals I went through, I tried to just manually walk away from the portal and after so mnay seconds it set me back at that portal. It continued to do so every time I walked away from it. How am I supoosed to do a quest with glitches like that?
Terribley pathetic!!!!!!!! You know what else I noticed? When installed it has this certain game security program installed to run while the game is on. Can't remember the name but stats with X then about 4 more letters. That same security program, I have seen installed with quite a few games I tried has caused a problem for every one of them I played. Usually it just shuts down the game after some message about another program being a security issue. I shuts them down after about a minute or so when I first open the games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113813562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9526, 'last_played': 1405016763}
review:
Fiesta Online is a free-to-play MMORPG. Fairly standard stuff. The cartoonish graphics are easy on the eyes and the Lore is fairly rich. Most importantly, however, the community is fairly nice and it's easy to make friends here. While there are items that require cash to buy, there's no real pressure in the game to get them. If I were to recommend any MMORPG to someone, it would [i]definitely[/i] be this one.

However, Fiesta Online has one critical flaw: it is a time-draining, virtually-endless game. Do not play this game unless you are willing to sacrifice at least 4 hours a day, every day, for the rest of your life. The game is definitely easy to work with for the first ten levels, but the next ten are truly horrifying. Getting to level 20 in this game is incredibly difficult. It's not that the game is challenging; the hard part comes from forcing yourself to sit there and grind for the countless hours necessary to get out of the gloom that is the lv. 17-19 range. The game picks up after that, but only for so long. The cruel cycle continues to repeat itself. [b]This game will eat your life.[/b]

If you like the typical WoW-style MMORPG setup, then, sure, this game is great. However, ultimately, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041803186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1449021037}
review:
Summary: Fiesta is an anime-themed massively multiplayer online (MMO) game that emphasizes group play. It is simple enough for ten-year-olds, but a few annoying bugs and a very grindy lategame may discourage you after many hours of play. It is free, and buying in-game items can help speed you along without breaking the game.

Positives:
1. Fiesta is simple as MMOs go: you don't so much *win* the game, but you gain levels by earning EXP from completing quests. Quests mostly require killing monsters, collecting drops from monsters, or gathering items in the wilderness. The quests and overarching storyline are text-based and perhaps tangential to the game itself; there is virtually no real "roleplaying" of your character. Don't let the anime feel fool you: you spend the bulk of your active gaming time looking for monster spawn points and exterminating them.

2. If dressing up your character in funny and cute cosmetic items is a draw for you, you will be pleasantly surprised at the wide variety of available costumes, hats, ears, pets, and mounts you can (rarely) earn or buy in the real-money store. Most cosmetics give a mild buff, such as increased critical hits or more EXP, and some can be earned by leveling, playing games of chance in the Lucky House, or completing timed rewards during in-game events.  You can run around in a t-shirt, butterfly wings and rainbow tube socks while fighting the bad guys, and still have all your gear equipped and active. Even a free-to-player can earn about 15 specific cosmetics by the time a character reaches level 66.

3. A handful of typical classes provides some variety, but you only acquire perhaps 10-20 skills unique to each class, so there isn't the deep customization you would find in action RPGs like Diablo or World of Warcraft. That said, you can spend skill points on your favorite skills to make them more powerful, cheaper to cast, or to refresh their cooldowns faster. You also get stat points to increase the raw abilities of your character also.

4. Fiesta boasts one one of the few truly female-friendly gaming communities. Also, the gender of your character can be chosen on creation regardless of class and without effect on your character's stats. Also, if you're a parent of a potential user, Fiesta has virtually no content that is inappropriate for preteens; only the chatter of the other players need be monitored. There is also no way in-game to purchase real-money content; the store is on a separate, secure website.

Negatives:
1. Fiesta needs to address a few bugs that cause the game to crash repeatedly, usually caused by switching areas or standing around in populated areas. This is causing the existing community to slowly leave, however the most popular server (Bijou as of this writing) still enjoys a large population. If you want to play alone or just with some close friends, you can choose one of the other servers and not be bothered much by chat spammers or other annoyances.

2. No Steam overlay for a Steam game.  No Steam Guard for a Steam game; it still utilizes a third-party anti-malware software (X-Trap). You can't use Steam Wallet Funds to buy Slime Coins, the currency used by the parent company, Gamigo (at least that I can find). Steam does little more than hold the shortcut for you, much like a non-Steam game you've added to your library. So what's the advantage of being a Steam game...?

3. Some of the crafting skills (i.e. making potions and scrolls) require you to spend hours of real time crafting many more items than you will ever need or sell. It's something you can have the game running in the background while you do other tasks, but it is kind of a pain.

4. On one hand, the game is growing: some low-level maps have had graphical updates, and the level cap has increased to 125 replete with new areas, quests, and items to find.  On the other hand, the North American servers are slowly depopulating, just because there are so many other games out there to play, and that the patches (and bugfixes!) of new content are coming too slowly. If you can find friendly players and join a Guild Academy, you are more likely to stick with playing longer. But playing solo is a real grind (even for me, and I'm used to grinding solo).

Free Advice:
1. You will level MUCH slower if you ignore the quests and just find a place to grind.  Until level 30 you can play as you wish, but in later levels, most of your EXP will come from completing repeated quests, not from defeating the monsters required by the quests.  That said, I hope you like grinding, because in the mid-game (say your level is in the 60s) a typical quest may require you to kill 40 of a monster for 4% of your required EXP to gain a level, and a repeatable quest will require 120 of a monster to earn 7% of the required EXP.

2. Save your skill points until you have played the character for a few hours and have become comfortable with your hot-keyed skills. You cannot unspend the skill points unless you spend real money to do so. Maxing out the power and maxing out reduced cooldown time of your main attack skills is common.

3. As far as your stat points, most players maximize their character's Strength in order to increase damage, unless you are a Wizard (max INT instead). Depending how you play your character, however, you may put a few points in SPR (to have some more SP and to crit more often), and perhaps a bunch in END (for extra health when you intend to get hit a lot).

4. You can earn a lot of random cosmetic items by participating in month-long Attendance Events. By logging on for one hour a day per character, that character can earn a reward of 1-3 cosmetic items per week, as well as another reward for earning attendance for at least 21 of the 28-day event. Stash these items, then use them when you're bored or when you plan to do a lot of leveling!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069761705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1687894350}
review:
I read another review here that said that this game is recommended to those who are just starting to play mmorpgs. I completely agree. Fiesta was one of the first mmorpgs I've ever played and somehow, I still love it (even with all the repetiveness and grinding). Why? The community is nice (which I find very assuring when you're just a starter, so this is the big concept I want to point out to beginners). People will always help you when you're least expecting it; whether it be a random buff from a cleric or people asking if you need help in your guild -you can always rely on the community. 
I might be naive saying this, but I've played other mmorpgs to some extent as well, and at some point they all have their repetiveness, so as far as the gameplay goes... what's so bad? The skills have increasing levels that you unlock as you level up, and skills that you eventually come to gain. You don't come equipped with all your skills and for me, I found that such an exciting experience when I first started playing. [If anyone else has played Vindictus then I would like to compare: you do get skills along the way, and can level them up to some degree, but unless you're not into the whole paladin/dark knight thing then there's no other skills] I always looked forward to getting new skills in Fiesta and still do (because I haven't reached the level cap yet since I've taken such a long time off this game, but I still come back to it).
Now if you don't like grinding or P2W then sorry; this is definitely NOT the game for you if you plan on playing it for a while. This is the reason I've taken long breaks and the only reason.

Overall, I definitely recommend this games to starters of the mmorpg worlds. 
Even so, I still recommend this game to experienced mmorpg players as well. This game goes back to the classics. Classes of Fighter, Mage, Cleric, and Archer can never let you down. To add, the developers have even added Trickster, and Crusader to those who want a little variety. note* Crusader becomes availible at level 60. I always seem to come back to this game even if it is repetitive because I miss it, and I think others who have reviewed have the same feelings. It's a relaxing game that has cute sprites and reliable gameplay. I think that's all from me ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198104540256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1412049860}
review:
Sin duda al inicio es divertido no muy dificil pero cuando te haces nivel alto te hacen comprar cosas para poder seguir subiendo, todos usan cosas en nivel alto compradas y no hay forma de conseguirlas en el juego asi que si pagas seras OP.

Este juego es un excelente ejemplo de un Pay to Win y si no comparas cosas te sera imposible subir  por la cantidad tan enorme de mobs que hay que matar para subir un 1% o en PVP es imposible ganar sin algun objeto de pago.

Si quieres un juego PTW este es indicado para ti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050804681', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1459410838}
review:
This game is pretty much dead in the water. I played this game in it's first few years, 2007-2010, and it was great.. I made lots of online friends (many of which i still keep in touch and/or play other games with) and generally had a really good time. The game itself is a generic mmo with rather simple mechanics, it's essentially a beginner's MMO... but of course that's not what made Fiesta fun, what made it fun was the social aspect.. unless you make friends and join a guild you ARE NOT GOING TO HAVE FUN, this game isn't for "lone wolfs" that are just looking to play a game and level up because it gets extremely tedious.
I downloaded this game again after seeing it on Steam while mindlessly browsing in order to see how much it has changed and damn, has it changed. This game is now just a shadow of the shell of what it used to be..that's right, it's not even just a shell of it's former self, it's the shadow of it's shell... the reason being, there's very few people playing and even fewer new players getting into the game, it's currently Friday night and the server populations are all on Low.... It's mostly just populated by a handful of true newbies that in all likelyhood won't make it past level 50 and the rest are veteran gamers that have sunk way too much time and/or money to quit, which is made evident by the high number of not only high level characters but also mid to low level characters with +9 - +11 gear whom are most likely just alts belonging to veterans. I looked around the low level maps and saw only a few people doing quests, all of them by themselves of course.. Roumen to Uruga ( they're the maps for levels 1 to 60 ), checked all the maps in between and didn't see more than 10 people, none of them were in parties/groups.. just solo'ing. If you look at the screenshot of a group of players above, that's pretty all the people you'll see in Elderine which is the main vendor map...half of those people will most likely be AFK though, so you'll only see around 20 active players in that main city map.

So in short, don't bother playing this game.. I imagine it won't be around for another year or two.
*sigh* it really was nostalgic running through the maps though, almost brought a tear to my eye remembering all the good times I had with my old guildmates.. all the fun, drama, and plain old silliness. 
Bijou, Angel_Assassins and Rye <3 ^-^

review: I played this game once upon a time when it was just starting out 8 years ago, but for various reasons (mainly I got bored after a few months) I stopped playing. I come back and find it in the Steam store all these years later. I also find out my old login didn't work so I have to start again. I currently play a ranger on the Apeline server and joined  a guild academy called A_Forgotten_Past, with a few nice guild members to help me get started again. Some things I remember, but a lot has been improved since I've been gone, and it reminds me of a saying I used to describe it by: "It's like WoW, but a lot more colorful!" If you feel like trying something like WoW out but don't want to pay a monthly fee, this might be a good game to try out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088262661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1409623935}
review:
This game is free for a reason. Downloaded game and registered to play. When launching the game, it changed entire Windows screen resolution settings to 1200 x 800 or something terrible. Tried to login to the game... try different username/password. Logged into the registration website no problem. Tried to plug that same username/password for the game itself... nope, same error. Reset password... successful login. How silly. 

I changed the screen resolution in game back to something normal. One of the first things the game wants you to do is purchase gear and a weapon from the black smith (yes they have it as two words, black smith.) I purchased weapon, but then can't purchase or click on any gear except one item that is for a different class that I can't even use. 

I think there have been enough problems in the first 5 minutes that I don't need to bother wasting any more time with this game. What a piece of crap. lol

review: This is one of the most influential games of our generation. The sole idea tears down the foundation of video games with its originality and uniqueness. This game is one of those once-in-a-lifetime games that grabs hold of you with its stunning graphics and immense immersion. It will have you sinked in to its pay-to-win gamestyle along with its simple "click to attack" game mechanics. Its simplistic menu makes flipping through countless pages of quests and character screens easy as counting to 3. Dont even get me started on the music, I downloaded the entire soundtrack to the game yesterday and I have to say that I have never made a better choice in my entire lifetime. 10/10 Never been done before, could not recommend enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056518494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1451587553}
review: You cannot rate this game poorly till you have reached level 90 to where you NEED to make this game a pay-to-win. Though this isn't the issue I'm faced with, it's just how irritating how imbalanced classes are. As a 100 sharpshooter you cannot kill a single enemy in pvp even though sharpshooter is made for pvp. We just get pwned by a mage who can 1 shot us or spam their magic blast, and gladiators who dash to you and somehow land the stun perfectly even though sharpshooters have the best evasion in the game. Also dex is broken, as an archer it's impossible to kite enemies without speed scrolls which cost a fortune if you're broke. And one last thing, at higher levels it's impossible to find a +11 bow/crossbow from venders as with archer sets. The game is supposed to get a rebalance, but that was said by gm's about 3 months ago. If you want to play this game I highly suggest to play an op class like Fighter, Mage or Cleric.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136833442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1404352525}
review:
I played Fiesta sometime in 2010-2011 so I'm not new to this game, was on and off the game for about a year before I quit for good. This is going to be a fair review for a game that is quite old compared to the "new-gen" mmo's, comparing the good parts and the bad. 

Now the only reason I recommend this game is because I would recommend it to new players who are playing their first mmo, why you ask? Because this game is fairly good when one doesn't expect anything from a mmo, people that have played mmo's before are not going to like it only because they have played better. Fiesta isn't top notch and never will be but it's a good starting point for anyone who really wants to start getting into online gaming. Fiesta has a nice community, diverse classes (traditional mage/fighter/cleric/archer type of deal with a few different ones, crusader/trickster), and a huge PvE aspect from level 1-115 (Or whatever the cap is at now). When I say PvE I mean there's a lot of things to do, but there's a short list of what you SHOULD do to level and not just mess around. You can get pretty much anything without paying a penny but its extremely difficult, there's only 2 people that I know of that have never payed a penny and still were able to cap with high end gears. The guild/academy system is very useful as you can always find help provided that you joined popular guild or a guild with at least 5 people who still play. 

Now for the people that have played mmo's before, don't bother trying with this game. Compared to most mmo's this is pretty far down the list of "good games." It's pretty old and follows old mmo standard playstyles, it's very grindy and it's very P2W (pay to win) there's a large gap when you compare people who don't pay vs those who do. And it's not spend 10$ and you can get some good stuff like in other games, you nearly have to pay 40-50$ a month now to be properly "geared" with sc (slime cash/cashshop) items for the MONTH. 

Now the PvP is very tricky. I can say that it's bad and that it doesn't require any skill for a fighter/mage since they're the "PvP classes" of the game since they're easiest to spam skills with or that the cash shop really overly unbalances the PvP with the stat increases + some multipliers of skills = insta death but I have seen people fight really well using any other character that is supposively "bad" for PvP so it really does depend on skill in the end along with a little push of SC. ( the company has got to make money somehow right?)

In the end, recommended as someone's first mmo but not recommended for anyone who has played any mmo before.

Edit: gamigo feeds from games that people have invested time into. They speed up the process to kill the game while monetizing as much of it as possible. I highly recommend that the company have different names other than gamigo since they have a strong reputation for this.

Play it only if you want to take information of game design to know whats good to monetize and whats not. What is good for a game and what is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045169741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 16267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1619558801}
review:
There is nothing wrong with the game itself. The problems lie within 2 things.

1. The creators of the game are money hungry. It is extremely hard to ignore this when every person you see around has +9/+10 gear. (These are the best enhancements for gear, which can only be obtained with either buying things from the store to stop your gear from breaking and increasing success rate, or you can try with a 95% chance for your gear to break otherwise.

2. The community is basically dead. Most maps have only veterans or new players who have just started. Also, a lot of the community likes to scam you out of your money. You will come across the rare "helpful player" every so often though.

So, let me enlighten you on something that will make this worth your time, and will cost you less (Or no) money.
Private servers. Servers made by a community that cares about its players more than it's income, unlike Gamigo.

Unfortunately, I am unable to name any off the top of my head, but there is a site with a top 100 for them, look it up.

Now, these servers are more user friendly than the original server. Here is a list of things they do compared to the original.

- Most cash shop items (If not all) can be bought with in-game cash instead of your credit card. 
-Exp is multiplied (ALL servers have different rates!! ) to prevent you from "Requiring" an exp x2 card from the shop. 
-Drop rates are higher, but usually not to the point where you get a drop every kill.
-Money is easier to get, and items that are sold by other players are usually fairly priced, unless it is godike. (Max stats on it)
-Server maintenance is usually weekly for most servers, usually fixing bugs and adding in custom items, bosses, and more.
-Like I said above, custom content exists. Most servers will also accept user-made content, if that's your thing.
-Some servers run purely on donations, others DO have a cash shop, but they usually only contain non-gamebreaking items.
-Every server has a different feel and experience.
-Much more.

So really, the game is alright, but can be easily improved as shown by private servers.  If I were you, I'd skip the steam download and take the time to look one up, as It's well worth your time to try them out.

Good luck, and I hope you take my advice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042534522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1531703972}
review:
I played this game for 2 years on Epith...I did a stint in WarGodZ, Judgement and bunch of other lame ass guilds. However, it's SO easy to get hooked. The majority of the hardcore players are either people with a surplus income and have nothing to spend it on...so no kids and they live alone...OR...it's people who have absolutely no life whatsoever that they spend 24 hours a day just grinding mats to make money and then buy the enchanted gear. 

Granted...I had a blast pissing people off in full charms in PVP...but still. This game is a poor excuse for an MMO. It's a grindfest...and unfortunately every aspect of the game is set up so you can keep spending money. I played this game for 2 years and I must've spent about 100 bucks a month on charms/xp boosts/outfits/customizations/enchanting mats. It was pathetic. I could've paid for my car 2 times over with all the money I spent on making my character all 'elite'...and it didn't matter...if you're not willing to suck some guild masters dick...you're not gonna be able to raid or do anything remotely fun in the game. That's why 90 percent of the community sat around in town talking smack...and only the elite 10 percent of the active community were all in the same one guild and they'd farm the one raidable boss in the world...which isn't instanced so any other guild was shit outta luck.

My advice? Stay the fuck away from this game unless you have absolutely no goals for your life that take place outside of your house. If the most interesting thing that happens to you in your day is that your cat looks at you...buy this game. If not...go play a real MMO.

review: Fun game a long time ago when it had first started it's open beta which was i think 5-6 years ago.  Noobs were running around, the community was great, and there were plenty of kingdom quests (essentially raid type events that you would queue for every hour or two) that filled up pretty fast.  I've logged into the game recently and saw that the game was pretty much empty, everyone on my friends list has moved on and worst of all, kingdom quests were no more because they relied on a booming community.  It's sad to see a game like this die because it was the first mmo i've ever played, but unfortunately it is a dead game.  :[

author: {'steamid': '76561198003316054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1402058981}
review:
Slight disappointment...

Fiesta is a Free to Play "Anime" MMORPG, Anime being a loose term for the style of art used and not the actual feel of the gameplay itself.

Graphics:  5/10

The Graphic team that put this together probably put alot of effort into it, but the cocders who turned it into a game probably stripped away alot of what they did to make room for other functions... They should have put alot more into the visualstyle instead of leaving things bare-bones pastels. Not bad, but definitely not good... evenf or a Free-to-Play game.

Audio:  3/10

Like most MMORPGs the audio ranges of the game almost feel like they are bringing back the old 8-bit music ranges. Constant loops and single grunt dubs are all you have to look forward to. This combined with some other lack luster features convinced me to do an uninstall after reacching level 7.

GamePlay: 1.5/10

Like most other MOORPGs out there the variety of quests are limited to:
1) Kill this for me
2) Get this for me
3) Do this for "Yourself"
Nothing really new here, but they way that the quests were set up could have been more creative without hacing to add any new features. Grinding gets boring fast, and having to use the rest function (which heals you at an agonizingly slow rate) shows you that you either have to be as patient as a Saint, or be willing to forrk over some cash for a game that isn't going to be getting much better.


For the most part, this game was everything I hope to not find in an MMORPg of any caliber, but one thing that did please me was the "Free Stat" system which most RPG players are happy to see. The ability to choose where your stat point go into is always a nice thing :3


So unless you have the patience to lug through a fairly clumsy battle system and agonizingly slow walking speed, you might want to look into play some other MMORPG. You've been warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086998669', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1423965010}
review:
This game.. Oh man, this game is so much fun! I do miss it when Outspark had it though.. 
To all you people saying this is a "generic" or "typical" is wrong. This game has so much creativity and so much stuff to do. 




You have 5 classes: Fighter, Mage, Archer, Trickster, and Crusader. All pretty self-explanatory. 

The graphics are good, the music is nice and peaceful, the community, I must admit, isn't THAT good, but I bet it'll get better.  


Overall, Fiesta is a fun little game that you can play either with friends or alone, join Guilds and Academy's, make new friends, and just have fun. If you like Anime-style MMORPG's, this game is a MUST for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087711716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1404234831}
review:
This is the game that got me into online gaming. What can I say? I saw an ad, liked the colorful characters, and signed up. It's a fairly unimaginative game with very little free customization. I began playing back in 2008 and when I tried signing in a few months ago, my characters had been deleted, including all my mounts, custom character designs, and upgraded weapons (all of which cost money). I didn't try very hard to get the game back up and working after that.

But back in 2008, I invested a ton of time and a nice chunk of money in Fiesta Online. What eventually drove me away was the community and the grinding. If either could have been better, I might have stuck around but the carpal tunnel-like symptoms and the bickering were enough to make me quit.

I tried signing in again today, knowing full well it would mean starting over. I was curious. The same three hairstyles, three faces, and three hair colors are present. They updated the character creation screen but it fails to impress. They added a class, which I've only played for a brief period of time, but the mechanics of the game are still pretty much the same. The starting gear is the same cowgirl-esque stuff from 2008. They added a tutorial which I find frustrating to get through but maybe that's because I've done this all before. I think it could have been a bit more streamlined than it presently is. It was really boring standing in place as I swing the same mallet from 2008 at the same Honeying for several minutes before it dies.

As a Cleric, I still don't get any offensive abilites until a handful of levels in. The graphics are the same. Roumen appears to be the same. The controls are still clunky and because I've experienced other games since Fiesta, it was enough to make me lose interest. When I closed the game down, the same "Fiesta.bin has stopped working" error came up. Ah, nostalgia.

It's a very grind-heavy game in which dying means redoing HOURS of repetitive monster killing. Some levels give you a small handful of quests, others give you none meaning you have to space your quest turn-ins out so you don't go crazy.

All in all, the game does not appear to be any better than it was 6 years ago but I can't say I was expecting it to be.

I will, however, say that I rather liked the Kingdom Quests and still think they're a neat idea. You sign up for a KQ and go into an instanced zone with a number of other players and defeat the end boss. I would say the KQs are probably the more creative aspect of Fiesta Online. They're timed and utilize different mechanics to make them interesting. They tend to require a decent amount of teammwork which can be both good and bad. I also like that, even though I'm currently back on foot and moving slowly, I can press a button to lead me to my objective and basically AFK until I get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028797999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1400789582}
review: The game default settings on my system were 1024x768.  This is the lowest resolution my 24" monitor can do and in the process the bottom 1/4 of the screen was still cut off.  I was able to log in but when I get to the Create character/enter game screen the button's wouldn't line up with the hit box and no way of manually changing resolution that I could find in the directory so I uninstalled it immediately.  Since when do games default at 1024x768?  From reading the other reviews thank god I wasn't able to get into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063954196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1400632058}
review:
Fiesta Online is a typical, generic free-to-play-buy-to-win anime MMORPG played by a dead community that consists of veteran players who have invested too much time and money on this game to let it go~ Basically living in denial. In a world where you can't even change your graphics quality, players assume the role of a fantasy hero and play out their life long dreams of being anime characters; desu-desu. Regular bug fixes, rehashed events, and more than 115 levels of doing the same thing over and over again with hundreds of hours of gameplay (thousands if you don't buy $500 worth of microtransactions) await you!

Having a hard time hitting that next level? Well don't worry we got 150% EXP Boosters there for you. This allows you to level up twice as fast! Now it'll only take 15 gameplay hours to go from 80-81!

Drop rate boosts are also available so you don't have to spend 10 hours killing the same Great Goblin King over and over for a chance at that rare item!

Lets not forget mounts! Even you can run around at the speed of sound with these guys! (Food for the mounts must be bought separately from the cash shop)

Who wants charms? These charms let you wreck any other player or monster in this game easily. Build a full physical damage Mage and still kill kiddies with your 200% boosted stats.

Can't enchant your item because there's a 90% chance of it breaking and going away forever? Buy some ENCHANT BREAKING PROTECTION. Want to upgrade the chance of the item actually upgrading? Buy some UPGRADE CHANCE FOR UPGRADING stones. Want to upgrade the upgrade amount per upgrade? Buy some more unfair shit. 

Either spend your life playing this to get better or pay to improve instantly. If you don't believe me on how much of a big deal this game's in-game cash shop is, try it out for yourself. Hell I played this for 3 years and thought it was great, then I graduated elementary school and got a PC.

R.I.P. 
Aka_Ryu guild (Bijou server)
